title: Business Analyst Consultant -IV (Remote)
job_description: Location: Madison, WIDuration: 1+ MonthsJob Description:The client is focused on public safety through the custody and supervision of those in our care. Corrections employees have the opportunity to positively impact the lives of others through careers in a variety of fields. Using cutting-edge research and evidence-based approaches, employees implement lasting change that positively impacts the people of Wisconsin.The client of Management Services is recruiting for an EHR Business Analyst/Consultant IV position. This position will be located at our central office at 3099 E. Washington Ave., Madison, WI (Dane County), and will only allow 100% remote for in-state resident applicants.Position Summary:This position is 100% remote, except on the first day they should report to the office for onboarding. The person is responsible for implementing, maintaining, and configuring projects related to the support of the client’s Health and Behavior Solutions team. EHR platform is a vendor solution from Oracle Cerner, the State of Wisconsin’s Corrections Support Bureau of Health Services. This position serves as a member of the EHR core team staff, which includes Department employees from the Bureau of Technology Management, the medical staff from the other program divisions, and the EHR private vendors. This position works closely with the working group to help identify areas of optimization and improved business processes for workflows within EHR. This position will also execute the build and test required for effective EHR optimizations, reporting using Discern analytics and SAP Business Objects (BO), and upgrades in Provider, Nursing and Pharmacy workflow, Dentrix and Dragon Medical One, etc.Additional Details:Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs for client’s application software. Formulates systems to parallel overall business strategies. Experienced with EMR workflows and their configuration, business process reengineering and identifying new applications of technology to business problems to make business more effective. Familiar with clinical needs in the Corrections environment, industry standards, current and emerging technologies, and business process mapping.Total Hours: The positions are 40 hrs. per week till 06/30/2025 and are subject to fiscal year renewals based on performance and budget.Job Details:Applicants must be legally entitled to work in the United States (i.e., a citizen or national of the U.S., a lawful permanent resident, or an alien authorized to work in the U.S. without client sponsorship) at the time of application. The client will conduct criminal background checks on applicants before selection to determine whether the conviction circumstances may be related to the job being filled. Upon hire, all new client employees are subject to fingerprinting.The client may conduct pre-employment drug screens. Any applicant offered employment in a position requiring a pre-employment drug screen must pass the screen as a contingency to employment. Applicants who fail or refuse the drug screen will not be given further consideration for employment.Minimally qualified applicants will have experience:Existing Knowledge of SAP Business Objects SolutionsMaintaining and vendor-managed software, performing maintenance, testing, upgrades, and configurationsCommunicating software configuration with external and internal stakeholdersWorking with external stakeholders to identify process improvements and optimizationsExperience engaging with users to troubleshoot and resolve application-related issuesExisting knowledge of EHR / EMR Systems. In addition to the above, well-qualified applicants will have experience: Experience in Agile environment and System Development Life CycleTest script maintenance and Test automationWorking in a government or correctional environmentB.A. shall have experience with the ability to understand and document Business requirements. Experience in change management systemsKnowledge of vendor-based application release cycle and ticket managementGood business process mapping and process capture through Visio flow diagrams. Ability to identify integration points. Knowledge of reporting and dashboard maintenance. Experience in process improvements and I.T. systems integrationAbility to work with cross-functional teamsAbility to work with business teams and good communication and presentation skills. Experience in User Acceptance Testing (UAT), running regression tests on systems, and identifying, designing, and optimizing new and existing test casesJIRA tool experience. (nice to have)Experience with SQL and PL SQLFollow Good Documentation Practice. Top Required Skills & 5 Years of Experience: Experience implementing, supporting, and/or configuring EMR/ softwareExisting Knowledge of SAP Business Objects SolutionsMaintaining and vendor-managed software, performing maintenance, testing, upgrades, and configurationsCommunicating software configuration with external and internal stakeholdersWorking with external stakeholders to identify process improvements and optimizationsExperience engaging with users to troubleshoot and resolve application-related issuesExisting knowledge of EHR / EMR SystemsNice to Have Skills: Experience in Agile environment and System Development Life CycleTest script maintenance and Test automationFamiliarity with clinical needs in the Corrections environmentExperience with the Cerner Electronic Medical RecordPowered by JazzHRSWKPIEny5h

title: Early Career Business Analyst
job_description: Great companies need great teams to propel their operations. Join the group that solves business challenges and enhances the way we work and grow. Working at Gainwell carries its rewards. You’ll have an incredible opportunity to grow your career in a company that values your contributions and puts a premium on work flexibility, learning, and career development.SummaryAs an Early Career Business Analyst at Gainwell, you can contribute your skills as we harness the power of technology to help our clients improve the health and well-being of the members they serve — a community’s most vulnerable. Connect your passion with purpose, teaming with people who thrive on finding innovative solutions to some of healthcare’s biggest challenges. Here are the details on this position.Your role in our mission“Analyze this” and help create innovative, purpose-built technologies and solutions to deliver better health and human services outcomes. Collaborate with a team of business analysts making client recommendations that can improve business processes  Translate your client’s business needs from the requirements generated for our technical teams into simpler non-tech language  Help your team analyze and document systems requirements and business processes  Build basic conceptual data and process models to quantify the potential impact of changes to the system  Verify that client requirements are built into the system design by executing and analyzing basic test case scenarios from existing test plans  Be part of technical reviews and inspections with senior leaders to ensure the final product meets client expectations  Expand your technical skills in software applications such as Microsoft Excel, SQL or Visio to enhance your expertise in this role What we're looking for Basic understanding of the software development life cycle and software such as Microsoft Office  Basic analytical and problem-solving skills to assess business needs and triage bugs and defects  Clear and effective oral and written communication skills in a professional work environment  Interest in working at the intersection of the ‘technical’ and ‘non-technical’ and learning more about business processes and re-engineering  Knowledge of claims is preferred, but not required.  Ability to work in a team environment with other professionals What you should expect in this role Fully remote opportunity within the Continental US. The pay range for this position is $44,500.00 - $63,500.00 per year, however, the base pay offered may vary depending on geographic region, internal equity, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. Put your passion to work at Gainwell. You’ll have the opportunity to grow your career in a company that values work flexibility, learning, and career development. All salaried, full-time candidates are eligible for our generous, flexible vacation policy, a 401(k) employer match, comprehensive health benefits , and educational assistance. We also have a variety of leadership and technical development academies to help build your skills and capabilities.We believe nothing is impossible when you bring together people who care deeply about making healthcare work better for everyone. Build your career with Gainwell, an industry leader. You’ll be joining a company where collaboration, innovation, and inclusion fuel our growth. Learn more about Gainwell at our company website and visit our Careers site for all available job role openings.Gainwell Technologies is committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, where all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical condition), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We celebrate diversity and are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Senior Business Analyst - Banking
job_description: Company DescriptionJobs for Humanity is collaborating with FIS Global to build an inclusive and just employment ecosystem. We support individuals coming from all walks of life.Company Name: FIS GlobalJob Description Position Type : Full time Type Of Hire : Experienced (relevant combo of work and education) Education Desired : Bachelor of Business Administration Travel Percentage : 1 - 5%Job DescriptionThe world of finance moves fast. At FIS, we’re faster. Our teams are empowered to learn, grow, and make an impact–in their careers and communities. We deliver innovation that advances the way the world pays, banks and invests. If you want to grow personally and professionally, we’d like to know: Are you FIS?About the team:Join our team today! We're looking for a passionate and highly-skilled Senior Business Analyst to perform competitive analysis, in depth research across our community and regional banks and large financial institutions, and identifyg new market opportunities and trends. The ability to communicate and present insights and opportunities is also a critical aspect of this role as you will be sharing information at all levels of the organization. You will work with senior level management to identify product level opportunities gathering/analyzing data on client preferences as it relates to our products. This role will provide important unifications across the division in shaping our strategic product roadmaps and equipping external facing teams to drive awareness of those changes. For example, for the product team, this role will help them understand customer needs and preferences, leading to the development of more successful products. And for sales and marketing teams, this role will help them target their efforts more effectively, leading to increased sales and revenue.What you will be doing:Drive growth by identifying new market opportunities and trends, conducting competitor analysis at the product and business level, and gathering/analyzing data on client preferences as it relates to our products Support senior/executive leadership in improving the Banking products and services, optimize go to market approach, and supporting market share expansion for our products Provide important unifications across the division in shaping our strategic product roadmaps and equipping teams to drive awareness of those changes Complete financial analysis across various tools to understand the financial competitive landscapeListen to company earnings calls and complete analysis around earnings reportProvide coaching and/or guidance to less experienced Business AnalystsPerforms analysis of the business goals, objectives and needs of the business environment for appropriate segment, division, group or line of businessWhat you will need:5+ years experience with business analysis in the financial services industry, specifically with banks and large financial institutions (LFIs)Business analysis experience of banking and technological industry trendsKnowledge of financial analysis principles and ratiosAbility to perform detailed analysis of competitors, provide high-level commentary and insights as a resultExperience with Power BI & KPI analysisProficiency in industry-standard process methodologiesBachelor’s in business administration, finance, computer science or information systems or the equivalent experienceAbility to review quarterly earnings reports and compare/contract with FIS reporting to glean areas of opportunityWhat we offer you:At FIS, we are as committed to growing our employees’ careers as our own business. We offer:Opportunities to innovate in fintechInclusive and diverse team atmosphereProfessional and personal developmentResources to contribute to your communityCompetitive salary and benefitsPrivacy StatementFIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice.EEOC StatementFIS is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster is available here supplement document available hereFor positions located in the US, the following conditions apply. If you are made a conditional offer of employment, you will be required to undergo a drug test. ADA Disclaimer: In developing this job description care was taken to include all competencies needed to successfully perform in this position. However, for Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) purposes, the essential functions of the job may or may not have been described for purposes of ADA reasonable accommodation. All reasonable accommodation requests will be reviewed and evaluated on a case-by-case basis.Sourcing ModelRecruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.#pridepass

title: Business Analyst
job_description: We are seeking a talented technical business analyst to assist in our efforts to redefine our contract and licensing processes, through workflow automation and other enabling technologies. This role will be working with a talented group of product managers, business stakeholders, engineering partners and design to redefine the way in which our technology streamlines our CLR processes through automation of workflow and integration of services with 3rd party vendors such as FINRA.Primary Duties & ResponsibilitiesCollaborate with peer groups, business partners and product managers to learn and document business area/domain processes. Current State, Future State and Gap Analysis: Assess and document (process maps) multiple current state processes, in a single business area / domain (Contract License & Registration). Assist with task-based work items in more complex situations. Gather Requirements: Gather complex product requirements with a general understanding/knowledge of products in remit. Review and validate requirements gathered from business partners. Author User Stories and/or Features: Author user stories and/or features independently with low to medium complexity while participating in some task-based work in higher complexity situations. Co-facilitate with product manager, the daily Scrums, Sprint Planning Meetings and Sprint ReviewsTest Plan Review: Assist with coordinating and build of test plans. Independently execute test plan & scenariosProject Management: Use project management principles to successfully complete and advance work. QualificationsBachelor's degree preferred. Minimum 3-5 years prior experience as technical business analyst or similar role. Ability to lean on strong communication skills to influence outcomes while approaching conflict with organizational savviness. Knowledge Preferred: knowledge of the financial services industry, familiar with workflow automation tools (highly desired), experience with technical business analyst role, product owner or Scrum Master role, and working in a highly complex business domain. Certifications demonstrating mastery of role specific competencies. Deep familiarity of agile & scrum development environments. Solves problems in straightforward situations; analyzes possible solutions using technical experience, judgement, and precedents.

title: Business Analyst  - Portable Power
job_description: It’s a challenge and an invitation. Most importantly, it’s an opportunity to join an industry leader that’s shaping the market and investing in its people, along with new growth and technologies. Our rapid growth equals rapid career advancement opportunities for those who want to be challenged and enjoy a fast-paced, high-performance culture. We focus on personal and professional development; encourage learning on the job and being a supportive team member; and hope each day of work brings purpose and pride.	The Business Analyst will analyze and interpret complex data sets to provide insights and recommendations that will help stakeholders deliver on key goals which include increasing sales, enhancing margins, and gaining market share for our product line of portable generators.  To achieve these results, the Business Analyst will leverage automation and visualize tools to deliver proactive insights, utilize advanced statistical methods to uncover patterns and trends in data, and track team performance relative to stated KPIs/OKRs. Additionally, the Business Analyst will be responsible for scoping data infrastructure and systems that will support the team's ongoing analysis and reporting needs.Given this role will support multiple functional areas, the Business Analyst must be adept at delivering diverse requirements with unique timelines and comfortable managing the expectations of multiple stakeholders. The ability to become intimately familiar with our products, processes, and the overall marketplace for backup power will be essential for this role - so highly passionate and curious individuals are encouraged to apply.

title: Business Analyst
job_description: BUSINESS ANALYST POSITION FOR WISCONSIN RESIDENT ONLYContract to June 30 with 12 month renewalPOSITION SUMMARY:Under the supervision of the Project Management Office (PMO) Manager, this position provides business analysis support to top priority initiatives and enterprise-wide projects. This includes, but is not limited to, facilitating requirements sessions, documenting business needs and business processes, analyzing business processes, and applying and implementing both technology and non-technology focused solutions to business problems.In addition, this position partners with our Lead Business Analsyt and the Project Management Office Leadership as we develop business analysis standards, best practices, collaboration, education, and business analysis maturity.Top Skills & Years of Experience: 8 or more years of experience in the Business Analysis field Experience with business process reengineering and identifying new applications or technology that address business problems to make business more effective.  Experience creating process workflows Exceptional communication skills (written/verbal) with team members and executives High emotional intelligence Familiar with change management processes Familiar with industry standards, current and emerging technologies, and business process mapping, and re-engineering.  Ability to work independently with directions given by the Customer.  Experience with cross-functional work teams.  Ability to multitask. Nice to have skills: Experience using Visio, SharePoint and MS Teams.  Knowledge of project management, conflict resolution, and incident escalation.  Knowledge of government organization and hierarchy.  Knowledge of governmental regulations around identity management.  Familiar with adaptative methodologies. This position will assist and partner with project leadership to identify and prioritize opportunities that achieve the goals set for the enterprise. Ideal candidates follow standard business analysis industry practices, rely on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals, and can independently perform a variety of complicated tasks. A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected. The Business Analyst must have excellent communication skills and a high degree of emotional intelligence (EQ) in order to effectively work with a broad spectrum of business and IT leaders and subject matter experts throughout the enterprise.Candidates considered will have experience in the following areas: Review, analysis, and evaluation of business systems and user needs.  Understanding, representing, and documenting business areas/units and their needs.  Business process mapping, and reengineering, and identifying new applications of technology to business problems to make business more effective.  Process flow development.  Developing business requirements.  Documenting current and future states.  Identifying gaps and deficiencies.  Creating business and technical documentation, and user guides.  Preparing solution options, risk identification, and financial analyses such as cost/benefit, ROI, buy/build, etc.  Facilitating business and technical group discussions.  Communicating with technical and non-technical audience (presentations, briefings, broadcasting, etc.).  Experience collaborating with people of diverse background.  Familiar with industry standards and current and emerging technologies.  Familiar with adaptative methodologies. Codeworks L.L.C. is a full-service IT Consulting and Staffing Services company. Headquartered in Milwaukee, WI—Codeworks has more than 25 years of experience connecting great people to great companies. Codeworks services companies nationwide ranging from start-ups to Fortune 100 corporations. Our Recruiting team consists of highly skilled Talent Specialists who excel at evaluating, advising, and connecting IT professionals with new career opportunities that facilitate career growth.At Codeworks, we're committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion in our workforce and beyond. We believe in equal opportunities and value the unique perspectives that every individual brings to our team. Join us in creating an inclusive, innovative, and collaborative workplace where your talents can thrive.

title: Business Analyst - Senior
job_description: Genesis10 is currently seeking a Business Analyst - Senior for a contract lasting through December 2025 working with an insurance company in Milwaukee, WI. Job Description: Dig deep into a specific business area and help define the details of how to drive business results through technology. Work on a cross-functional team of product managers, engineers, designers and subject matter experts in an agile methodology to deliver on outcomes. Primary Duties & Responsibilities Provide deep expertise in at least one business area or domain with a broad understanding of business and domains surrounding the main focus. Articulate this knowledge as an authority at the department level. May be called on to provide insight at the enterprise level to provide detailed analysis. Current State, Future State and Gap Analysis: Independently assess and document current state across multiple processes, business areas and domains while consulting and mentoring other Business Analysts. Think strategically in understanding business drivers to define "target state" solutions. Gather Requirements: Lead requirement gathering for larger efforts and across multiple business domains or from other business analysts. Author User Stories and/or Features: Author user stories and/or features independently with medium to high complexity and sometimes across multiple teams. Act as an authority throughout the development process as required. Test Plan Reviews: Support solution delivery by coordinating and facilitating the business test planning and test execution by authoring, participating in, and ensuring business sign-off of testing processes for medium and large efforts. Leadership: Work independently and may coordinate work for others and/or provide mentorship. Project Management: Use advanced project management skills to lead, complete and advance work. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree. 4-5 Years Prior Experience demonstrating business analysis. Knowledge and abilities to position themselves as the communications authority and go to resource for key information and decisions making. Domain expertise via previous internships or similar roles in the past. Certifications demonstrating proficiency in role specific competencies. Deep familiarity of agile & scrum development environments. title: Business Analyst
job_description: DescriptionOld Republic Surety Company (ORSC) is currently seeking a Business Analyst to join its Administrative Team at the home office located in Brookfield, WI. ORSC ranks among the nation's top underwriters of contractors' performance and payment bonds, miscellaneous surety, and commercial fidelity, offering thousands of types of bonds. We are growing across the country which is creating new opportunities across the organization. In general, the Business Analyst serves as a liaison between multiple business units and technology teams to define processes, identify process improvement opportunities, and implement new functionality. This position will document stakeholder requirements, measure/monitor process efficiency, and develop and manage projects. In addition, this position coordinates implementation, testing, training, and communication efforts with vendors and multiple business groups.DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Partner with the business and technology delivery teams to ensure business processes are understood, documented, and fit the needs of the organization.Map processes from current to future state, define business and tech requirements and scope, and proactively champion change to business stakeholders and development teams.Ensure process documentation is created, stored in a shared environment, and remains current.Plan, execute, and manage configuration changes on Business Applications and SaaS solutions in support of business plans and requirements.Assist business stakeholders with testing system changes and analyzing data flows for process improvement opportunities.Partner with the Product Owner on product vision, requirements definition, and capability mapping to ensure requirements align with business unit processes and needs.Partner with business stakeholders in the development of business cases and project charters. Provide leadership for the implementation of process improvement opportunities by mapping out process changes, refining requirements and scope, and proactively communicating project capabilities to business leaders, stakeholders, and users. Other duties as assigned. QUALIFICATIONS:This position requires a Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or a related field and a minimum of five years of experience in formalizing business requirements and processes and working with various areas of a business delivering and supporting technology solutions. In addition, previous experience working within the insurance industry is required and ideally includes Surety-specific industry experience.Working as a Business Analyst requires one to work independently and effectively within a fast-paced environment. Proficiency with Microsoft (MS) Windows and Office products is necessary. Other skills necessary include excellent oral and written communication skills, strong organizational and accurate proofreading skills, the ability to maintain accurate records, the ability to exercise discretion with confidential information, strong attention to detail, and the ability to use a variety of office equipment.TravelThis position requires occasional travel by use of motor vehicle, public transportation, and/or airplane.PHYSICAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL DEMANDS:This position requires one to sit for extended periods of time and stand and/or walk occasionally. The position requires one to occasionally push, pull, carry, and/or lift up to 40 pounds. No personal protective equipment is required. Ergonomic equipment is available to employees.WHO ARE WE?Old Republic Surety Company underwrites contract, fidelity, and commercial bonds, serviced through a network of more than 4,500 independent insurance agencies. Solutions provided include bid bonds, performance and payment bonds, and maintenance bonds for large, middle market and smaller growing contractors. ORSC consistently offers superior service and creative underwriting options in all 50 states.WHY OLD REPUBLIC SURETY COMPANY?Old Republic Surety Company offers numerous opportunities for our employees to grow and prosper. We have a culture of growth from within and we support our employees’ pursuits in advancing their careers. We offer this in an open-door, collaborative workplace that encourages and rewards both teamwork and individual contributions. We want bright, passionate individuals who share our values and quest for success. To learn more about our company culture and our outstanding benefits, please visit our website and watch this video.Company BenefitsFinancial:Competitive salary 401k Savings & Profit-Sharing Plan, including company match contributionRoth investment options529 Education Savings PlanEmployee Referral Bonus ProgramHealth:Health InsuranceDental InsuranceFlexible Spending & Health Savings Account optionsLife InsuranceVision InsuranceSupplement Life InsuranceLong-Term Disability InsurancePaid Leave of Absence BenefitsAccident & Critical Illness InsurancePet InsuranceWork-Life Balance:38.75 hour standard work weekHybrid work opportunities available upon completion of trainingCasual business attireGenerous paid time-off (PTO)Paid holidaysVolunteer opportunitiesCompany-sponsored events and outingsInterested? Click ‘apply’ and follow some very simple steps to get your resume in front of the Talent Acquisition Team.Old Republic Surety Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to maintaining a diverse workplace.

title: Senior Business Analyst
job_description: About Apexon:Apexon is a digital-first technology services firm specializing in accelerating business transformation and delivering human-centric digital experiences. We have been meeting customers wherever they are in the digital lifecycle and helping them outperform their competition through speed and innovation.Apexon brings together distinct core competencies – in AI, analytics, app development, cloud, commerce, CX, data, DevOps, IoT, mobile, quality engineering and UX, and our deep expertise in BFSI, healthcare, and life sciences – to help businesses capitalize on the unlimited opportunities digital offers. Our reputation is built on a comprehensive suite of engineering services, a dedication to solving clients’ toughest technology problems, and a commitment to continuous improvement.Backed by Goldman Sachs Asset Management and Everstone Capital, Apexon now has a global presence of 15 offices (and 10 delivery centers) across four continents.We enable #HumanFirstDIGITALRole Description:You'll be responsible for (Responsibilities):Gather Data Governance, Data Quality Rules, Profiling requirements from JAD sessions with business users. Identify and assess the impact of potential data quality issues on the company’s reporting and operational processes. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to establish and implement data governance and data management practices. Work closely with business users, subject matter experts to understand and document functional and non-functional requirements for various use cases. Analyse and interpret data sources, map source to target information, ensuring accuracy and relevance of data. Review and analyse data and data models including reports to augment the requirement for use cases with technical information for facilitating development and data modelling activities. Design and develop Activity Diagrams, Sequence Diagrams, and OOD to represent the requirements to communicate the information effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders. Effectively communicate insights and recommendations to cross-functional team members and management via meetings and presentations. Write data analysis SQL queries to profile and document metadata to analyse data and augment key inputs required. Play key role in the Planning, User Acceptance Testing, and Implementation of system enhancements and conversions. Develop strategic partnerships with the business units to develop a solid knowledge base of the business line including the business plan, products, process, and revenue streams. Develop business requirement specification documents as well as high-level project plan. You'll have (Qualification & Experience):Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Business Administration, Data Science, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. Minimum of 8 years’ experience as a Business Analyst, Data Analyst, or similar role. 5+ years of experience in SQL and Database Management. Should have experience in SAP S4 HANA, ECC. Excellent analytical, problem-solving skills with strong knowledge of best practices in data governance and data management. Proficiency in reporting tools like Tableau and SAP Analytics Cloud for data visualization and reporting. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex data in an understandable manner. Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment as well as independently. It would be great if you have (Additional Skills): Self starters and go getter Strong communication skillsYou’ll have (Qualification & Experience): Bachelor's Degree in related field is required. Don’t worry if you don’t check all the boxes; we’d still love to hear from you.Our Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:Did you know that Apexon has been Certified™ by Great Place To Work®, the global authority on workplace culture, in each of the three regions in which it operates: USA (for the fourth time in 2023), India (seven consecutive certifications as of 2023), and the UK.Apexon is committed to being an equal opportunity employer and promoting diversity in the workplace. We take affirmative action to ensure equal employment opportunity for all qualified individuals. Apexon strictly prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind and provides equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to gender, race, color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.You can read about our Job Applicant Privacy policy here Job Applicant Privacy Policy (apexon.com)Our Perks and Benefits:Our benefits and rewards program has been thoughtfully designed to recognize your skills and contributions, elevate your learning/upskilling experience and provide care and support for you and your loved ones.As an Apexer, you get continuous skill-based development, opportunities for career advancement, and access to comprehensive health and well-being benefits and assistance.We also offer:Health Insurance with Dental & Vision401K PlanLife Insurance, STD & LTDPaid Vacations & HolidaysPaid Parental LeaveFSA Dependent & Limited Purpose careLearning & Development

title: Business Analyst
job_description: ResponsibilitiesKforce has a client in Middleton, WI that is seeking a Business Analyst who has the primary responsibility to elicit, analyze, validate, specify, verify, and manage the real needs of the project stakeholders, including customers and end users. The Business Analyst serves as the conduit between the customer community and the software development team through which requirements flow. Summary: The Business Analyst is involved at some level throughout the entire software development life cycle. Upon establishment of the requirements baseline, the focus is shifted towards the management of the requirements set and verifying their satisfaction through business requirements, criteria, use cases, and business rules. Responsibilities Include: Work with the product manager, product owner or project sponsor, or Subject Matter experts to document business requirements Decompose high-level business and user requirements into functional requirements, specified in an appropriate level of detail and in appropriate forms suitable for use by those who must base their work on the requirements with help from the PMO team Facilitate detailed requirement gathering interviews and team meetings, employing professional interpersonal skills to include tact, diplomacy and empathy Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, storyboards, surveys, business process analysis, use cases or user stories, scenarios, task and workflow analysis with help from the PMO team Represent requirements using alternative views, such as visual analysis models (diagrams), prototypes, or simulations, where appropriate Write requirements specifications according to standard templates, using natural language simply, consistently, concisely, comprehensible, traceable, feasible, unambiguous, and verifiableRequirements Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Business Administration or related discipline; May be substituted with 4 years directly related experience 2+ years of experience in a Business Analyst related role Ability to utilize PMO methodologies and practices in a professional office setting (Agile and Waterfall) Ability to manage workload across multiple, parallel projects in a dynamic and fast paced environment Demonstrated effective verbal and written communication skills Demonstrated analytical thinking, problem solving and organizational skills Demonstrated ability to develop, maintain and foster relationships at all levels of the organization An understanding of contemporary requirements elicitation, analysis, specification, validation, and management practices and the ability to apply them in practice Intermediate proficiency working with Microsoft Excel, Word, Outlook and PowerPointThe pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.Salary: $45 - $55 per hour
Industries: Retail Office Equipment, E-Learning Providers, and Professional Training and Coaching

title: Business Analyst
job_description: Talascend is currently seeking a Business Analyst for a remote contract opportunity100% remote, prefer candidates in EST/ CST zonesSUMMARY:You will play a pivotal role in building a new business resilience framework that spans across our entire organization. Your expertise will be instrumental in developing strategies, tools, and templates to enhance our resilience. This temporary position offers an exciting opportunity to support a transformative initiative and make a lasting impact on our organization's ability to thrive in the face of uncertainty.RESPONSIBILITIES:Support the development and implementation of a comprehensive supply chain business resilience framework, encompassing all aspects of the organization's operations, processes, and functions.Collaborate with stakeholders from various business units and functional areas to assess current resilience practices, identify gaps, and develop strategies for improvement.Develop tools, templates, and documentation to support the implementation of the business resilience framework, including risk assessment methodologies, recovery strategies, and response and management protocols.Identify and prioritize critical processes, dependencies, and resources to ensure effective risk management and continuity planning across the organization.Establish and document business resilience governance structures, including the operating models, working groups, and communication channels, to oversee framework development and implementation.Develop and coordinate training sessions, workshops, and exercises to educate employees on business resilience principles, procedures, and their roles and responsibilities in maintaining organizational resilience.Collaborate with IT and data management teams to identify critical data needs and system requirements for future enhanced IT implementations.Develop metrics, key performance indicators (KPIs), and reporting mechanisms to measure the effectiveness of the business resilience framework and track progress over time.Assist in the development and execution of a change management plan to promote awareness of the business resilience framework and ensure alignment with organizational objectives.Coordinate closely with Business Continuity Management team to enhance business continuity program in alignment with new business resilience framework.REQUIREMENTS:Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Risk Management, Emergency Management, or related field (or equivalent experience).5+ years of experience in business resilience, business continuity, or related disciplines, with a focus on framework development and implementation.Strong understanding of business resilience principles, methodologies, and industry standards.Experience in developing tools, templates, and documentation to support resilience planning and implementation efforts.Excellent communication, leadership, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively engage and influence stakeholders at all levels of the organization.We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those qualified individuals who closely meet the qualifications of the position will be contacted. The details of the position are only a summary, other duties may be assigned as necessary.Background Check and Drug Screen may be required.Talascend is an Equal Opportunity Employer that recruits and hires qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, disability, or veteran status.

title: Business Process Analyst
job_description: Introduction If you have experience providing software support and training to end users including troubleshooting complex software issues; gathering user requirements; software testing; and creating training materials for end users, we encourage you to apply for the Business Process Analyst position at the Wisconsin Court System.Join an elite information technology team as we develop, implement, and support new web-based software in support of the Wisconsin Court System. Individuals who enjoy developing and supporting cutting-edge software in a team environment, and working directly with end users as they migrate to new systems are encouraged to apply. Candidates must be self-motivated and have a commitment to providing high-quality systems and services to the Wisconsin Court System. Multiple hires are expected.Position SummaryLOCATION: Madison, WI, certain positions with this Department may allow remote work for a portion of their work schedule, depending on the needs of the position and the work unit. This topic may be discussed in the interview process. The position is headquartered in Wisconsin and selected candidates may be expected to report to office locations in Wisconsin on short notice. Employees residing outside the state of Wisconsin are not eligible for full-time remote work.SALARY: Starting salary will be $88,400 annually, with a State of Wisconsin benefits package. Job Details  Provides advanced software support to Wisconsin Court System employees, attorneys, legal staff, state and local governmental agencies and the general public using CCAP-provided desktop and custom web-based applications via phone, email and chat. 2) Implements new and upgraded software by conducting in-person and remote training, creating user documentation, and designing training materials. 3) Performs software testing and provides software development support to CCAP’s programming teams by creating user requirements, software design, writing and executing tests, and conducting user acceptance testing on behalf of users. 4) Completes special projects.Qualifications Experience providing software support. 2) Expert level understanding of business processes, requirements gathering, and quality assurance techniques. 3) Excellent written and oral communication skills, and interpersonal skills. 4) Experience effectively training adult learners. 5) Excellent knowledge of computer systems, including commercial and custom desktop and web-based software applications. 6) Ability to analyze the business functions and the IT needs of the court system and to identify the appropriate solutions. 7) Ability to prepare training materials and technical documents for end users. 8) Ability to travel statewide to train CCAP customers and implement new software systems throughout the enterprise. 9) Knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles preferred.Special Requirements Employment will require a criminal background check. 2) Must meet the minimum standards for driving a state vehicle. 3) Must be able to travel throughout the State of Wisconsin with occasional overnights.How To ApplyPlease submit a cover letter and resume in a single .pdf document indicating the position Business Process Analyst – #24-2417 to human.resources@wicourts.gov. All materials should address your relevant education, experience, and skills as it relates to the qualifications and special requirements listed above. Failure to follow these procedures may result in your disqualification. Deadline to Apply In order to be assured consideration, applications must be received by 11:59 PM on May 12, 2024. The Wisconsin Court System will provide reasonable accommodations to qualified applicants when requested. For additional information on the court system, visit our website at www.wicourts.gov.Upon request, all prospective employees can obtain a copy of the Equal Employment Opportunity Utilization Report.

title: Business Analyst
job_description: DescriptionDo you consider yourself a project professional with a history of working within a team and as a manager? Are you knowledgeable in business systems analysis and project management? If so, you might be interested in this exciting role Robert Half is trying to find for a company in the Energy/Natural Resources industry.As the Business Analyst in this particular role, experience analyzing accounting functions and systems will be extremely valuable. You will be servicing Business Analysts creating requirements documentation and developing new methods of data mapping to accounting systems for the most efficient accounting and reporting of transactions. The role will additionally support the accounting leadership team and other key participants in the accounting process, ensuring that their input and feedback is incorporated into key initiatives. If you have an aptitude for keeping financial projects on budget, you could be the candidate we are searching for! project risk and issues identification, assessment, tracking, and mitigation Expertise in business and technical requirements analysis, documentation, modeling and testing methodologies & development General familiarity with System Enhancements Experience with Business Requirement Document Proven knowledge of Business Unit Comprehensive knowledge of communication Liaison experience Practical knowledge of EO/IR systems Command of Presentations Strong familiarity with implementation Well-founded grasp of Enhancement Know-how of project management software like Microsoft Project, SmartSheet or other similar applications Experience working with or in an accounting function with a key role in system projects preferred Bachelor's degree in accounting or finance & Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification Use and act upon independent judgementTechnology Doesn't Change the World, People Do.®Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. job_description: About Apexon:Apexon is a digital-first technology services firm specializing in accelerating business transformation and delivering human-centric digital experiences. We have been meeting customers wherever they are in the digital lifecycle and helping them outperform their competition through speed and innovation. Apexon brings together distinct core competencies – in AI, analytics, app development, cloud, commerce, CX, data, DevOps, IoT, mobile, quality engineering and UX, and our deep expertise in BFSI, healthcare, and life sciences – to help businesses capitalize on the unlimited opportunities digital offers. Our reputation is built on a comprehensive suite of engineering services, a dedication to solving clients’ toughest technology problems, and a commitment to continuous improvement.  Backed by Goldman Sachs Asset Management and Everstone Capital, Apexon now has a global presence of 15 offices (and 10 delivery centers) across four continents.  We enable #HumanFirstDIGITAL Role Description: You'll be responsible for (Responsibilities):Gather Data Governance, Data Quality Rules, Profiling requirements from JAD sessions with business users.Identify and assess the impact of potential data quality issues on the company’s reporting and operational processes.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to establish and implement data governance and data management practices.Work closely with business users, subject matter experts to understand and document functional and non-functional requirements for various use cases.Analyse and interpret data sources, map source to target information, ensuring accuracy and relevance of data.Review and analyse data and data models including reports to augment the requirement for use cases with technical information for facilitating development and data modelling activities.Design and develop Activity Diagrams, Sequence Diagrams, and OOD to represent the requirements to communicate the information effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders.Effectively communicate insights and recommendations to cross-functional team members and management via meetings and presentations.Write data analysis SQL queries to profile and document metadata to analyse data and augment key inputs required.Play key role in the Planning, User Acceptance Testing, and Implementation of system enhancements and conversions.Develop strategic partnerships with the business units to develop a solid knowledge base of the business line including the business plan, communication skills

title: Business Analyst/Consultant IV (129565)
job_description: Position SummaryThis position is 100% remote, except on the first day they should report to the office for onboarding. The person is responsible for implementing, maintaining, and configuring projects related to the support of the DOC’s Health and Behavior Solutions team. EHR platform is a vendor solution from Oracle Cerner, the State of Wisconsin’s Corrections Support Bureau of Health Services. This position serves as a member of the EHR core team staff, which includes Department employees from the Bureau of Technology Management, the medical staff from the other program divisions, and the EHR private vendors. This position works closely with the working group to help identify areas of optimization and improved business processes for workflows within EHR. This position will also execute the build and test required for effective EHR optimizations, reporting using Discern analytics and SAP Business Objects (BO), and upgrades in Provider, Nursing and Pharmacy workflow, Dentrix and Dragon Medical One, etc.Job DetailsApplicants must be legally entitled to work in the United States (i.e., a citizen or national of the U.S., a lawful permanent resident, or an alien authorized to work in the U.S. without DOC sponsorship) at the time of application. The Department of Corrections will conduct criminal background checks on applicants before selection to determine whether the conviction circumstances may be related to the job being filled. Upon hire, all new DOC employees are subject to fingerprinting.The Department of Corrections may conduct pre-employment drug screens. Any applicant offered employment in a position requiring a pre-employment drug screen must pass the screen as a contingency to employment. Applicants who fail or refuse the drug screen will not be given further consideration for employment.Required SkillsTop Required Skills & Years of Experience: 5 years' experience implementing, supporting, and/or configuring EMR/ software Good understanding of Provider, Pharmacy, and Nursing workflow in EHR. Maintaining and vendor-managed software, performing maintenance, testing, upgrades, and configurations. Communicating software configuration with external and internal stakeholders. Working with external stakeholders to identify process improvements and optimizations. Experience engaging with users to troubleshoot and resolve application-related issues. Existing knowledge of EHR / EMRNice To Have Skills Familiarity with clinical needs in the Corrections environment Experience with the Cerner Electronic Medical RecordDesired SkillsIn addition to the above, well-qualified applicants will have experience: Experience in Agile environment and System Development Life CycleTest script maintenance and Test automation.Working in a government or correctional environment.B.A. shall have experience with the ability to understand and document Business requirements. Experience in change management systems.Knowledge of vendor-based application release cycle and ticket management.Good business process mapping and process capture through Visio flow diagrams. Ability to identify integration points. Knowledge of reporting and dashboard maintenance. Experience in process improvements and I.T. systems integration.Ability to work with cross-functional teams.Ability to work with business teams and good communication and presentation skills. Experience in User Acceptance Testing (UAT), running regression tests on systems, and identifying, designing, and optimizing new and existing test cases.JIRA tool experience. (nice to have)Experience with SQL and PL SQL.Follow Good Documentation Practice.

title: Equipment Business Analyst
job_description: Improving America’s infrastructure isn’t for the weak. It takes grit, determination, and hard work to execute high impact projects. Michels Corporation engages 8,000 people and 18,000 pieces of heavy equipment in our insatiable drive to be the best. Our work improves lives. Find out how a career as an Equipment Business Analyst can change yours.As an Equipment Business Analyst, your key responsibilities will be to research, analytics, and documentation of financial information to support the Equipment group. Develop, maintain, update, and improve monthly, quarterly, and annual Equipment reporting and analytics, and reconcile costs and expenditures and review the Equipment division’s financial statements.Why Michels? We are consistently ranked among the top 10% of Engineering News-Record’s Top 400 Contractors  Our steady, strategic growth revolves around a commitment to quality  We are family owned and operated  We invest an average of $5,000 per employee on training each year  We reward hard work and dedication with limitless opportunities  We believe it is everyone’s responsibility to promote safety, regardless of job titles.  We offer a comprehensive benefits program, including Health, Dental, Life, Flexible Spending Accounts, Health Savings Account, Short Term and Long-Term Disability Insurance, 401(k) plan, Legal Plan, and Identity Theft and Monitoring Plan. Depending on your positions and location you may participate in a different benefit plan. Why you? You thrive in fast-paced environments under tight deadlines  You relish new challenges and evolving technology  You enjoy collaborating and communicating with your teammates  You like to know your efforts are noticed and appreciated  You enjoy the satisfaction of structured and meticulous work  You exceed in your ability to handle multiple projects at once. What It Takes Bachelor’s Degree with preference to Finance or Accounting, and/or 5+ years of equipment, finance or accounting experience, or an equivalent combination  Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite  Experience with: COINS, HCSS, B2W, Telogis, Fleet Focus, Power BI, Salesforce, Toolwatch(desired)  Michels Experience (desired)  A valid driver license for the type(s) of vehicles you may be driving and an acceptable driving record  AA/EOE/M/W/Vet/Disability

title: EDI Business Analyst
job_description: Description Springs Window Fashions is hiring an experienced EDI Business Analyst to join our growing IT Analyst Team (This role can be based out of our Madison, WI area Corporate Headquarters or Chicago, Milwaukee, the Fox River Valley area, or other locations with a reasonable commute Madison as there is an on-site expectation of around three days per month)Springs Window Fashions has been part of the window treatments industry since 1939. Headquartered in Middleton WI, we have over 9,000 associates worldwide. Our products are available in nearly every major retailer, in thousands of designer showrooms and showcased in large commercial buildings.Our company is privately owned with products marketed across a broad portfolio of brands including Bali, Graber, SunSetter and Mecho. We pride ourselves as “The Best Experience Company”, striving to provide the best experience for our consumers, channel partners, and associates.We are bringing new innovations to the market at an accelerating pace and have a lot to offer consumers who want to improve their home décor The EDI & Product Configuration Team - We help turn tangible products into electronic masterpieces We’re seeking an EDI professional to join our growing team. You will work directly with some of the largest retailers in the world to ensure doing business with Springs Window Fashions is easy, accurate, and efficient.To accomplish this, you will collect and document requirements, and use the requirements to design, configure and test projects related to order acceptance, product mapping, and invoicing through EDI interfaces. Throughout the process, you will troubleshoot issues, meet with business users and track metrics regularly to verify solutions. Success at Springs Window Fashions Top performers at Springs Window Fashions require little direct guidance but love to collaborate, share ideas, and drive change. This position requires a sufficient level of experience with EDI interfaces, a passion for improving existing processes, and a desire to overcome technical challenges.Job SummaryThe EDI Business Analyst is responsible for coordinating and executing programs to make doing business with Springs Window Fashions easy and efficient through electronic interfaces. This role will support both our customers and customer service staff, as well as be a valuable part of our IT and Product Configuration team.Responsibilities Document business/customer requirements and develop functional and technical specifications/designs.  Translate Business Requirements and designs into technical solutions.  Perform unit and integration testing for configuration and end to end EDI processes.  Work with business partners on an ongoing basis to ensure solutions are meeting business requirements.  Ongoing responsibility of production support of the EDI process and solutions  Troubleshoot and resolve issues in a timely manner.  Analyze, track and remediate root causes of defects.  Analyze reports to determine opportunities and communicate results frequently to business RequirementsEducation and Experience Bachelor's degree in Information Technology or related business field required.  1+ years of Business Analysis experience with an EDI emphasis.  Experience working with iSeries, TrustedLink , Biz Manager , and EDI mappers  Experience with Query 400, and DBU preferred.  Experience with RPG400, ILE and Free preferred. Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities Strong Business Process experience required.  Strong knowledge and experience with requirement specifications to define scope and system boundaries, recommend alternative methods to achieve complex system requirements and estimate resource implications of requirements at a high level  Looks for innovative ways to streamline work processes across our customers and involves stakeholders  Accountable for delivering quality work while meeting project deadlines  Ability to translate business requirements into process and technical specifications  Ability to analyze problems and provide clear recommendations  Excellent communication skills, written and verbal  Solid interpersonal skills, ability to work bi-directionally through the organization  Able to multi-task and work under tight deadlines  Establishes forums to share best practices  Must be an effective problem solver  Up to 5% travel may be required Behavioral Competencies Ensures Accountability – Holding self and others accountable to meet commitments  Drive Engagement – Creating a climate where people are motivated to do their best to help the organization achieve its objectives  Instill Trust – Gaining the confidence and trust of others through honesty, integrity, and authenticity  Drive Results – Consistently achieving results, even under tough circumstances  Consumer/Customer Focus – Building strong customer relationships and delivering on customer-centric solutions  Critical Thinking – Making Sense of complex, high quantity, and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems  Being Resilient – Rebounding from setbacks and adversity when facing difficult situations  Optimize Work Processes – Knowing the most effective and efficient processes to get things done, with a focus on continuous improvement
Industries: Manufacturing, Wholesale Building Materials, and Retail

title: Senior Business Analyst
job_description: Job#: 2025081Job Description:Our great client in Downtown Milwaukee has an immediate opening for a Senior Business Analyst. If you are interested please apply with resume to [email protected] .Must haves: Agile - Business Analyst  Agile Product Owner  Attention to detail, organized, agile, eager to learn, strong sense of ownership Nice to haves: Ability to create strategic solutions that support business and technical needs  Excellent communication skills focused on facilitation of meetings; ability to deliver informative, well-organized documentation and presentations and ability to effectively communicate in difficult and sensitive situations Summary Dig deep into a specific business area and help define the details of how to drive business results through technology. Work on a cross-functional team of product managers, engineers, designers and subject matter experts in an agile methodology to deliver on outcomes. Primary Duties & Responsibilities Business Expertise: Provide deep expertise in at least one business area or domain with a broad understanding of business and domains surrounding the main focus. Articulate this knowledge as an authority at the department level. May be called on to provide insight at the enterprise level to provide detailed analysis. Current State, Future State and Gap Analysis: Independently assess and document current state across multiple processes, business areas and domains while consulting and mentoring other Business Analysts. Think strategically in understanding business drivers to define "target state" solutions. Gather Requirements: Lead requirement gathering for larger efforts and across multiple business domains or from other business analysts. Author User Stories and/or Features: Author user stories and/or features independently with medium to high complexity and sometimes across multiple teams. Act as an authority throughout the development process as required. Test Plan Reviews: Support solution delivery by coordinating and facilitating the business test planning and test execution by authoring, participating in, and ensuring business sign-off of testing processes for medium and large efforts. Leadership: Work independently and may coordinate work for others and/or provide mentorship. Project Management: Use advanced project management skills to lead, complete and advance work. Qualifications Bachelors degree. 4-5 Years Prior Experience demonstrating business analysis. Knowledge and abilities to position themselves as the communications authority and go to resource for key information and decisions making. Domain expertise via previous internships or similar roles in the past. Certifications demonstrating proficiency in role specific competencies. Deep familiarity of agile & scrum development environments. Solves complex problems; takes a new perspective on existing solutions; exercises judgment based on the analysis of multiple sources of information. Skills-Proficiency Level: Adobe Analytics - Intermediate Atlassian JIRA - Intermediate Business Analysis - Intermediate Business Cases - Basic Continuous Improvement (CI) - Basic Gap Assessments - Advanced Industry Benchmarking - Intermediate Microsoft Power BI - Intermediate Process Mapping - Intermediate Product Demonstrations - Intermediate Requirements Gathering - Advanced Structured Query Language (SQL) - Intermediate Storytelling - Basic Test Planning - Advanced User Research - Intermediate Wireframing - IntermediateEEO EmployerApex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. title: Senior Business Analyst - Banking
job_description: Position TypeFull timeType Of HireExperienced (relevant combo of work and education)Education DesiredBachelor of Business AdministrationTravel Percentage1 - 5%Job DescriptionThe world of finance moves fast. At FIS, we’re faster. Our teams are empowered to learn, grow, and make an impact–in their careers and communities. We deliver innovation that advances the way the world pays, banks and invests. If you want to grow personally and professionally, we’d like to know~ Are you FIS?About The TeamJoin our team today! We're looking for a passionate and highly-skilled Senior Business Analyst to perform competitive analysis, in depth research across our community and regional banks and large financial institutions, and identifyg new market opportunities and trends. The ability to communicate and present insights and opportunities is also a critical aspect of this role as you will be sharing information at all levels of the organization. You will work with senior level management to identify product level opportunities gathering/analyzing data on client preferences as it relates to our products. This role will provide important unifications across the division in shaping our strategic product roadmaps and equipping external facing teams to drive awareness of those changes. For example, for the product team, this role will help them understand customer needs and preferences, leading to the development of more successful products. And for sales and marketing teams, this role will help them target their efforts more effectively, leading to increased sales and revenue.What You Will Be Doing Drive growth by identifying new market opportunities and trends, conducting competitor analysis at the product and business level, and gathering/analyzing data on client preferences as it relates to our products  Support senior/executive leadership in improving the Banking products and services, optimize go to market approach, and supporting market share expansion for our products  Provide important unifications across the division in shaping our strategic product roadmaps and equipping teams to drive awareness of those changes  Complete financial analysis across various tools to understand the financial competitive landscape  Listen to company earnings calls and complete analysis around earnings report Provide coaching and/or guidance to less experienced Business AnalystsPerforms analysis of the business goals, objectives and needs of the business environment for appropriate segment, division, group or line of businessWhat You Will Need 5+ years experience with business analysis in the financial services industry, specifically with banks and large financial institutions (LFIs) Business analysis experience of banking and technological industry trendsKnowledge of financial analysis principles and ratiosAbility to perform detailed analysis of competitors, provide high-level commentary and insights as a resultExperience with Power BI & KPI analysisProficiency in industry-standard process methodologiesBachelor’s in business administration, finance, computer science or information systems or the equivalent experienceAbility to review quarterly earnings reports and compare/contract with FIS reporting to glean areas of opportunityWhat We Offer YouAt FIS, we are as committed to growing our employees’ careers as our own business. We offer~Opportunities to innovate in fintechInclusive and diverse team atmosphereProfessional and personal developmentResources to contribute to your communityCompetitive salary and benefitsPrivacy StatementFIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice .EEOC StatementFIS is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics. title: EDI Business Analyst
job_description: Description Springs Window Fashions is hiring an experienced EDI Business Analyst to join our growing IT Analyst Team (This role can be based out of our Madison, WI area Corporate Headquarters or Chicago, Milwaukee, the Fox River Valley area, or other locations with a reasonable commute Madison as there is an on-site expectation of around three days per month)Springs Window Fashions has been part of the window treatments industry since 1939. Headquartered in Middleton WI, we have over 9,000 associates worldwide. Our products are available in nearly every major retailer, in thousands of designer showrooms and showcased in large commercial buildings.Our company is privately owned with products marketed across a broad portfolio of brands including Bali, Graber, SunSetter and Mecho. We pride ourselves as “The Best Experience Company”, striving to provide the best experience for our consumers, channel partners, and associates.We are bringing new innovations to the market at an accelerating pace and have a lot to offer consumers who want to improve their home décor The EDI & Product Configuration Team - We help turn tangible products into electronic masterpieces We’re seeking an EDI professional to join our growing team. You will work directly with some of the largest retailers in the world to ensure doing business with Springs Window Fashions is easy, accurate, and efficient.To accomplish this, you will collect and document requirements, and use the requirements to design, configure and test projects related to order acceptance, product mapping, and invoicing through EDI interfaces. Throughout the process, you will troubleshoot issues, meet with business users and track metrics regularly to verify solutions. Success at Springs Window Fashions Top performers at Springs Window Fashions require little direct guidance but love to collaborate, share ideas, and drive change. This position requires a sufficient level of experience with EDI interfaces, a passion for improving existing processes, and a desire to overcome technical challenges.Job SummaryThe EDI Business Analyst is responsible for coordinating and executing programs to make doing business with Springs Window Fashions easy and efficient through electronic interfaces. This role will support both our customers and customer service staff, as well as be a valuable part of our IT and Product Configuration team.Responsibilities Document business/customer requirements and develop functional and technical specifications/designs.  Translate Business Requirements and designs into technical solutions.  Perform unit and integration testing for configuration and end to end EDI processes.  Work with business partners on an ongoing basis to ensure solutions are meeting business requirements.  Ongoing responsibility of production support of the EDI process and solutions  Troubleshoot and resolve issues in a timely manner.  Analyze, track and remediate root causes of defects.  Analyze reports to determine opportunities and communicate results frequently to business RequirementsEducation and Experience Bachelor's degree in Information Technology or related business field required.  1+ years of Business Analysis experience with an EDI emphasis.  Experience working with iSeries, TrustedLink , Biz Manager , and EDI mappers  Experience with Query 400, and DBU preferred.  Experience with RPG400, ILE and Free preferred. Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities Strong Business Process experience required.  Strong knowledge and experience with requirement specifications to define scope and system boundaries, recommend alternative methods to achieve complex system requirements and estimate resource implications of requirements at a high level  Looks for innovative ways to streamline work processes across our customers and involves stakeholders  Accountable for delivering quality work while meeting project deadlines  Ability to translate business requirements into process and technical specifications  Ability to analyze problems and provide clear recommendations  Excellent communication skills, written and verbal  Solid interpersonal skills, ability to work bi-directionally through the organization  Able to multi-task and work under tight deadlines  Establishes forums to share best practices  Must be an effective problem solver  Up to 5% travel may be required Behavioral Competencies Ensures Accountability – Holding self and others accountable to meet commitments  Drive Engagement – Creating a climate where people are motivated to do their best to help the organization achieve its objectives  Instill Trust – Gaining the confidence and trust of others through honesty, integrity, and authenticity  Drive Results – Consistently achieving results, even under tough circumstances  Consumer/Customer Focus – Building strong customer relationships and delivering on customer-centric solutions  Critical Thinking – Making Sense of complex, high quantity, and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems  Being Resilient – Rebounding from setbacks and adversity when facing difficult situations  Optimize Work Processes – Knowing the most effective and efficient processes to get things done, with a focus on continuous improvement
