title: Business Analyst/Consultant III
job_description: Candidates MUST be WI residents or willing to relocate to WI at their own expense prior to starting. This position can work 100% remotely (within the state of WI).Position SummaryUnder the general supervision of the Applications Development and Management (ADM) Director and Assistant Director, this position is responsible for performing the work of IT Business Analyst This position is responsible for building relationships with state school district and library operations to understand information technology (IT) needs and provide service. This position provides technical assistance and support to staff in the Wisconsin Department of Public Instruction, local educational agency staff, and other community agencies in the planning, design, development, training, implementation, and review of IT solutions. This position assists the Applications Development and Management Team in the execution of the Agile\Scrum development methodology. This position will work with program area leads and external customers to gather system requirements and to prioritize requests; lead and participate in project development meetings, status report meetings, sprint planning sessions, and all other meetings concerning the group; develop product roadmap, setup and maintain Scrum board, managing and prioritizing the product backlogs, implementation plan, system deliverables, monitoring the work and responsible for the overall delivery of the product/project.Goals and Work ActivitiesBusiness Analysis and design of new systems and maintenance or enhancements to existing systemsInteract with users to define the business requirements of new systems and/or maintenance and enhancements to existing systems. Analyze business requirements, formulate, justify, and discuss design alternatives with the users to assist in the selection of a final design proposal. Determine the potential impact of new systems on current DPI resources, operating policies, and technical standards. Build knowledge of school district and library operations to understand and meet their needs. Work with customers to assess the scope and objectives, return on investment (ROI), risk, and budget for IT application efforts. Assist with the definition of requirements and the preparation of bid documents for the acquisition of applications and assist with the evaluation of responses. Discover, analyze, organize and document application functional and data requirements. Develop and evaluate solution alternatives that solve the needs of the business area or agency. Assist with training on agency applications for business area experts and program area liaisons, helping the business side understand applications and set training priorities. Study the impact of proposed business changes on the business-area applications. Facilitate application requirements gathering sessions. Interface with managers and management teams, presenting information about new or changed applications, potential new business opportunities in technical advances, and impacts on business rules. Analyze technical strengths and weaknesses of applications that are in use and those under consideration for purchase. Provide technical support to the procurement of solutions purchased from outside vendors.Collaboration with the Scrum team and the other stakeholders on quality assurance.Prepare test plans and test cases for new and existing systems. Analyze existing systems; provide design recommendations for improved performance and data integrity checks. Test and document new complex programs/procedures and revise to existing programs/procedures to meet the changing needs and requirements of WDPI. Develop and update documentation for customers and other applications technology staff. Perform system/integration testing. Provide customer assistance and training during acceptance testing and implementation. Works with Program Areas to verify team outputs meet customer needs and expectations.Knowledge, Skills, and AbilitiesExperience in writing user stories with acceptance criteria. Ability to perform business analysis. Ability to perform systems analysis and design. Ability to perform software quality assurance. Ability to work on complex relational database systems. Knowledge of database development technologies such as SQL Server or Oracle PL/SQL. Experience in Agile/Scrum development methodologies and practices. Knowledge or ability to learn Microsoft .NET or Java programming languages. Effective oral and written communication skills. Strong ability to work in a team environment. Decision-making and problem-solving skills. Knowledge in product/ Project management. Ability to perform meeting facilitation, presentations. Ability to plan, forecasting, execute and monitor project/product changes. Knowledge of data analysis techniques and needs assessment processes. Ability to retrieve, analyze, and interpret data from a variety of sources. Additional Details : Projected Start Date : 2024-05-06T00:00:00Projected End Date : 2024-06-30T00:00:00Client Company : State Of WisconsinVendor Pay Rate : 41.33Selling points for candidate : This is a high PRIORITY requisition. title: Strategic Business Analyst Intern
job_description: At Modine, we are engineering a cleaner, healthier world. Building on more than 100 years of excellence in thermal management, we provide trusted systems and solutions that improve air quality and conserve natural resources. More than 13,000 employees are at work in every corner of the globe, delivering the solutions our customers need, where they need them. Our Climate Solutions and Performance Technologies segments support our purpose by improving air quality, reducing energy and water consumption, lowering harmful emissions and enabling cleaner running vehicles and environmentally-friendly refrigerants. Modine is a global company headquartered in Racine, Wisconsin (USA), with operations in North America, South America, Europe and Asia. For more information about Modine, visit www.modine.com.Business Development InternThe Strategic Business Analyst will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact over 10 weeks contributing to Venture Capital research & acquisition projects as designated by the Vice President of Business Development.Key ResponsibilitiesWork with the Venture Capital team to develop, manage, and communicate Modine’s M&A funnel for venture opportunities to include: Conduct ongoing market research in focus business areas Opportunity and target identification, profiling and prioritization Modeling, contracting, and deal structuring Building products as needed for presentation to the executive team to include the CFO & CEO Maintaining strong working relationships with business partners and internal departments  Effectively communicating with all levels of management Required Education & QualificationsRequired EducationPursuing MBA degree with relevant finance or accounting coursework and strong academic performance. Completion of two semester of MBA course work by the end of May 2024 with an expected graduation date by the end of May 2025.Required Qualifications Strategic and creative thinking; distinguished written and verbal communications skills  Must have advanced Excel and PowerPoint knowledge and aptitude to learn new applications quickly  Ability to understand and manipulate financial valuation models Must possess unrestricted work authorization and not require future sponsorship  At least 4 years of relevant professional experience Modine is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Modine provides a competitive benefit package, which could include paid vacation, short term disability, 401(k), health, dental, vision, life insurance, flex spending benefits, tuition reimbursement, Health Savings Account and much more. title: Business Development Analyst
job_description: A Business Development Analyst’s (BDA) is responsible for analyzing data, processes, and systems to identify areas of improvement and recommend solutions. They will work closely with the Regional Sales Managers to understand business needs and requirements of the customer, and then use their expertise to develop strategies, gather and analyze data, and create reports to help decision makers make informed choices. Business analysts also act as a liaison between internal departments and business users to ensure that solutions are implemented effectively. They must possess strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills, as well as a deep understanding of business processes and technologies.Duties include (not limited to)Work in conjunction with Regional Sales Manager (RSM) on the followingRegular and constant communication relative to market competitive situations.Review daily WIN reports, CRM, Phocas and give feedback as needed.Assist and suggest sales and conversion goals and objectives.Sales Responsibilities Review sales reports and identify sales opportunities and dealer down initiatives for the region.Work with RSM on responding to “in need of help” from WIN reports through quick resolution.Consult with RSM to develop marketing strategies for assigned region.Communicate with RSM on inventory and customer service needs.Assist RSM with month & year-end sales summary reports for region and key accounts.Assist with follow-up on large job quotes.Work with vendors for deviated programs and follow up with capturing TPE.Follow up analyze and discuss set goals and expectations set for TM’s on programs.Rebates, corporate and contract price programs, freight deviations, restocks, and marketing incentives.Aid in route evaluation and inventory needs and communicate findings with internal departments and personnel.Assist RSM on region budget process.Attend Regional Sales MeetingsTravel seasonally to meet with key customers within assigned region.Communication of Market/Industry conditions and developments. A Business Development Analyst will possess and/or demonstrateStrong people skills needed for developing and sustaining internal, vendor, and customer relationships that would result in advanced sales of our key products.Important to be organized and the ability to manage multiple projects at the same time.Individual must be energetic, motivated self-starter, and able to perform duties with minimal supervision.Constantly demonstrate a positive attitude through cooperation and teamwork.Important to possess the ability to be coached, trained and mentored by others.Solid listening, verbal, and written communication skills.Above average math skills.Above average keyboarding and software skills.Ability to lead and present at meetings as needed.The ability to process and progress protocols inEnterprise PD MaintenanceEXCEL SpreadsheetsDisplay professional behavior to all internal and external contacts in conjunction with policies and procedures as outlined in the employee handbook.Flexible and critical time managementAbility to dedicate additional hours to support business needs and travel as needed.Reports to Business Development Analyst Manager Working Demands / RequirementsAbility to sit for long periods of time. General working knowledge of residential construction.Conclusion A Wausau Supply Co. Business Development Analyst will exemplify the high standards that have come to be associated with Wausau Supply Co. As a customer focused employee politeness, honor, integrity and the willingness to do what our competition will not, is expected in every interaction. The maintenance and growth of Wausau Supply Co. customer base and increasing margin/volume is every BDA’s prime objective.

title: Senior Corporate Strategy Analyst
job_description: Help us change livesAt Exact Sciences, we’re helping change how the world prevents, detects and guides treatment for cancer. We give patients and clinicians the clarity needed to make confident decisions when they matter most. Join our team to find a purpose-driven career, an inclusive culture, and robust benefits to support your life while you’re working to help others.Position OverviewThe Senior Corporate Strategy Analyst helps set long-range corporate strategy, track industry trends, evaluate internal & external market opportunities, and support leadership in aligning resources to deliver on those strategies. This position works with leaders from across the company to establish and clearly communicate the company’s long-range strategy. On an ad-hoc basis, this position also regularly supports key strategic initiatives throughout the company. This person is also responsible for supporting a collaborative environment that promotes positive teamwork where all members are working for the good of Exact Sciences. The successful candidate will demonstrate outstanding strategic thinking, collaboration, and communication.This is a Madison, WI based role. The ideal candidate is comfortable working onsite 3 days/week with the ability to work remotely the rest of the week. Relocation assistance is available if needed. Essential Dutiesinclude but are not limited to the following:Support the strategy and executive teams as they make key strategic decisions.Prepare high-quality presentations for internal and external audiences.Advise business leaders by providing data-based strategic direction to identify and address business issues and opportunities.Participate in the development of long-range strategies.Create and execute analytics solutions that lead to improvement and optimization in business performance and risk minimization.Work in collaboration with other business leaders to drive decisions based on data, facts, and analytical findings across the organization. Build and maintain models to support fact-based decision making with regards to long range planning, budgeting, and forecasting.Conduct quantitative and qualitative market research to aid the prioritization of corporate strategies (new products, product expansions, M&A, etc.).Build models to assist in the evaluation of new products and strategies.Evaluate individual market opportunities by assessing clinical need, reimbursement outlook, estimating market size, understanding product capabilities. Will require market research (qual and quant), literature reviews, internal coordination and research. Effectively communicate findings to Leadership.Support ad-hoc strategy projects involving market research, external consultants, and internal cross-functional teams.Analyze new product markets and help determine early commercialization strategies.Apply strong analytical skills, business intuition, and organizational ability skills.Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.Ability to operate in a cross cultural and complex matrix environment.Ability to build consensus across functions.Demonstrated qualitative and analytical skills with strong attention to detail.Adaptable, open to change and able to work in ambiguous situations and respond to new information or unexpected circumstances.Strong business acumen.Uphold company mission and values through accountability, innovation, integrity, quality, and teamwork.Support and comply with the company’s Quality Management System policies and procedures.Regular and reliable attendance.Ability to work nights and/or weekends.Ability to work on a mobile device, tablet, or in front of a computer screen and/or perform typing for approximately 90% of a typical working day.Ability to work on a computer and phone simultaneously.Ability and means to travel between Madison locations.Ability to travel 10% of working time away from work location, may include overnight/weekend travel.Minimum QualificationsBachelor’s degree.3+ years of experience working in a core business function (e.g., operations, facilities, finance, legal, human resources, etc.), with demonstrated ability to effectively contribute toward team goals 1+ years of experience working in corporate strategy, investment banking, business development, consulting, analytics, strategic marketing, or commercial strategy.Basic computer skills to include Internet navigation, Email usage, and word processing.Proficient in Microsoft Office to include Excel and PowerPoint.Demonstrated ability to perform the Essential Duties of the position with or without accommodation.Authorization to work in the United States without sponsorship.Preferred QualificationsBackground in Math, Science, Engineering, Business or Finance.4+ years of experience working in a core business function (e.g., operations, facilities, finance, legal, human resources, etc.), with demonstrated ability to effectively contribute toward team goals.Experience in a healthcare related field.Advanced skills in PowerPoint and/or Excel.Familiarity with data analytics and financial modeling.Salary Range:$85,000.00 - $135,000.00The annual base salary shown is for this position located in US - WI - Madison on a full-time basis. In addition, this position is bonus eligible, and is eligible to receive company stock upon hire as well as annually.Exact Sciences is proud to offer an employee experience that includes paid time off (including days for vacation, holidays, volunteering, and personal time), paid leave for parents and caregivers, a retirement savings plan, wellness support, and health benefits including medical, prescription drug, dental, and vision coverage. Learn more about our benefits.Our success relies on the experiences and perspectives of a diverse team, and Exact Sciences fosters a culture where all employees can develop personally and professionally with a sense of respect and belonging. If you require an accommodation, please contact us here.Not ready to apply? Join our talent community and stay up to date on what’s new at Exact Sciences.We are an equal employment opportunity employer. title: Business Process Analyst, FIS University Program
job_description: This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.   Position Type : Full time Type Of Hire : Associate Development Program (Full Time Hire) Education Desired : Bachelor's Degree Travel Percentage : 0%Job DescriptionAre you curious, motivated, and forward-thinking? At FIS, you will have the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging and relevant issues in financial services and technology. Our talented people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, entrepreneurial, passionate and above all, fun.Join the 2024 FIS University Program!As a 2024 FIS University Program full-time employee, you will have the opportunity to participate in team projects, community service activities, professional development seminars and work with a team that is invested in your growth, development, and success; including bi-annual performance connects with your manager.This Two-year Full-time Program Has Start Dates In January, March, June, And September With a Dedicated “Learning Week” Where You WillLearn how to work within a corporate environmentLearn about the exciting world of Fintech and the role FIS playsHear from FIS leadership about their journey and participate in senior leader networking opportunitiesBuild a network of your peers from across the organizationThis position is for a June 24, 2024 start.About The TeamFIS Loyalty delivers and supports engagement solutions to a broad customer base. Our flagship products support financial card loyalty programs and our Points as Currency Premium Payback product is leading the way to bring merchants and banks together and expand card reward benefits real-time where consumers shop and interact. As a Loyalty Business Process Analyst, you’ll work with our team of Product Managers developing the processes, artifacts and integration points to support our consumer redemption marketplace as well as our API services for our BaaS and CaaS products. You’ll be on the cutting edge of using Non-Fungible Tokens to enable exclusive redemption experiences connecting with state-of-the-art providers. You will help create the framework from which our next gen products will be developed. Working together with our technology and platform owners, this position sits at the crossroads of every interaction including customer apps. You’ll work as part of a team in a scrum setting and must be a self-motivated, proactive, and out-of-the-box thinker. We are passionate about our work and take a client-first approach to everything we do and our team is laser focused on delivering results.What you will be doingDiagrams and evaluates existing processes and drives efficiencies within those processesHelps define improvements in solution design, analysis and testing activitiesResponsible for complex business and systems process analysis, design and simulationDevelops metrics that provide data for process measurement, identifying indicators for future improvement opportunitiesMeasures performance against process requirementsWhat you bringBachelor’s degree in relevant field of studyProficiency in Microsoft Office SuiteFluent in English; Strong written and verbal communication skillsAdaptability, a drive to learn, and strong problem-solving skillsAbility to work well independently and within a teamBonus if you haveProficiency with VisioUnderstanding of consumer rewards programs, specifically bank card rewardsWhat we offer youCompetitive salary and excellent benefitsThe chance to work on some of the most challenging, relevant issues in financial services & technologyA broad range of professional education and personal development possibilities – FIS is your final career step!Time to support charities and give back to your communityA work environment built on collaboration, flexibility, and respectStudent Loan Repayment Program: FIS will PAY OFF participants’ undergraduate loan balance over 10 years of service! Eligibility starts after one year of tenure in the program. The benefit applied to undergraduate student loans for US-based degrees and must be in the employee’s name. title: Business Continuity Management Analyst
job_description: Talascend is currently seeking a Business Continuity Management Analyst for a Remote contract opportunity100% remote, prefer candidates in EST/ CST zonesSUMMARY:You will play a pivotal role in enhancing our business continuity planning efforts. The successful candidate will support the Business Continuity Manager and Global Leader for Business Continuity & Resilience and collaborate closely with stakeholders across the organization to assess current practices, develop robust tools and templates, and facilitate comprehensive planning processes that strengthen our resilience and readiness to respond effectively to unforeseen events.RESPONSIBILITIES:Assessments & Plan Documentation: Assist in the development, review, and documentation of business continuity plans, protocols, and procedures, ensuring clarity, completeness, and accessibility. Conduct business impact analyses (BIAs) and risk assessments to identify critical processes, dependencies, and vulnerabilities, and develop appropriate mitigation strategies and recovery plans.Metrics & Reporting: Develop and maintain metrics, key performance indicators (KPIs), and reporting mechanisms to measure the effectiveness of business continuity efforts and report to senior management.Tool & Template Enhancements: Enhance tools, templates, and documentation to support various aspects of business continuity planning, including risk assessments, business impact analyses (BIAs), recovery strategies, and plan maintenance.Stakeholder Collaboration: Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and departmental leads to assess existing business continuity plans, identify gaps, and gather input for improvement.Process Enhancement: Evaluate current business continuity planning processes and workflows to streamline and enhance efficiency, ensuring alignment with industry best practices and regulatory requirements.Training and Awareness: Develop and deliver training sessions, workshops, and awareness campaigns to educate employees on business continuity principles, procedures, and their roles and responsibilities in the event of a disruption.Testing and Exercise Support: Support the execution of business continuity tests, exercises, and simulations to validate plan effectiveness, identify areas for improvement, and enhance organizational resilience.Continuous Improvement: Monitor and analyze emerging trends, threats, and regulatory changes affecting business continuity and crisis management, providing recommendations for enhancements and updates to existing plans and processes.REQUIREMENTS:Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Risk title: E-Commerce Analyst
job_description: This E-Commerce Analyst for Batteries Plus will convert data into insights that drive productivity and profitability. The E-commerce Analystwill work with the E-commerce, Marketing, and Merchandising teams as well as external analytics partners. Additionally, you will assist in the review and development of KPI's and measuring performance in order to evaluate the success of the business's initiatives.The E-Commerce Analyst is an onsite role at our Batteries Plus corporate office in Hartland, WI. Does this sound like the next big step in your career? Apply today!ResponsibilitiesAnalysis and reporting: Provide business performance, behavioral analytics and voice of customer information by interpreting data across multiple departments. Provide insights on ecommerce performance, site behavior, conversion rate and optimizationDevelop automated dashboards that provide self-service reporting to stakeholdersCollaborate with Marketing and E-commerce teams to identify opportunities for site optimization improvements and enhancementsProvide insights on E-commerce projects and initiatives by sharing the appropriate analyticsExecute post analysis, A/B testing, and overall ecommerce performance using E-commerce applicationsSupport ecommerce performance: Perform analysis against ecommerce data sets to find patterns trends, and relationships using available toolsEvaluate the customer journey against desired business outcome and contribute to marketing experimentation design discussionsDaily performance monitoring for the e-commerce site to evaluate performance, find patterns, trends and relationships using analytic toolsQualificationsBachelor's Degree in Business, Marketing, Mathematics, Economics or related field1 or more years of relevant digital or ecommerce experiencePreferred QualificationsWorking knowledge and experience using analytics tools - Google Analytics (GA360 & GA4), GTM, Microsoft Excel, SQL, Big Query, Looker, TableauDemonstrated problem solving skills. Duties require considerable judgment to work independently to achieve results, or to devise new or modify and adapt existing methods, processes, procedures or standards to meet new or unusual requirementsStrong organizational skills. Ability to work independently with general oversight, plan and establish priorities to meet deadlines with good control and results. Able to develop and follow-up on plans and meet deadlines in a fast paced, changing environmentA Bit About UsBatteries Plus is the nation's largest and fastest-growing battery, light bulb, phone repair and key fob replacement franchise with a nationwide network of over 720 stores. We work hard here at Batteries Plus and have a lot of fun while doing it. Whether you work in our warehouse, one of our stores or at our corporate headquarters, our goal remains the same; to satisfy our customers, build trust and drive business while nurturing our team and working to be experts in our fields. That's life at Batteries Plus.It is the policy of Batteries Plus to provide equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other protected characteristic under applicable law.Job Posted by ApplicantPro

title: Business Systems Analyst
job_description: Company DescriptionJobs for Humanity is collaborating with FIS Global to build an inclusive and just employment ecosystem. We support individuals coming from all walks of life.Company Name: FIS GlobalJob Description Position Type : Full time Type Of Hire : Experienced (relevant combo of work and education) Education Desired : Bachelor's Degree Travel Percentage : 0%Job DescriptionAs the world works and lives faster, FIS is leading the way. Our fintech solutions touch nearly every market, company and person on the planet. Our teams are inclusive and diverse. Our colleagues work together and celebrate together. If you want to advance the world of fintech, we’d like to ask you: Are you FIS?About the team:   FIS is seeking a Business Systems Analyst to join our IBS Corporate Products Team. This position requires previous experience working closely with customers, business analysts, technical analysts, infrastructure, and application delivery team members to understand business requirements that drive the delivery of quality solutions the IBS Corporate Product Team at FIS offers. These core Banking solutions must be aligned with business and IT strategies and comply with the organization's standards and practices. Prefer that candidates have experience with Software Development Life Cycles for the successful implementation, maintaining and supporting of applications. FIS looks to implement software that is delivered on time, with high quality and within budget. The most successful candidate will have had previous banking applications experience, preferably in the area of PeopleSoft other GL Finance applications.What you will be doing:The Business Systems Analyst role within the Corp. Products Team varies from day to day but will include but not be limited to the following:Working with Clients to determine requirement for their project requestsTesting client project requests to validate functionality before client testing occursResearching issues reported by clientsTesting upgrades in various lower level environmentsTesting upgrades on production implementation weekendsWriting draft bulletins outlining system changesWhat you will need:5+ years of demonstrated business systems analysis experienceKnowledge of basic financial analysis principles and ratiosProficiency in industry-standard process methodologiesKnowledge of JiraFamiliarity of Service Now Incident, Request and Change ModulesBachelor’s in business administration, finance, computer science or information systems or the equivalent experienceAdded bonus if you have:Banking (AP/Finance Dept) experienceExperience with GL applicationsExperience in PSFT and/or integrated ERP systemExperience with balancing from interfaced systems to GLBI Publisher experienceVisual Basic ExperienceWhat we offer you:At FIS, you can learn, grow and make an impact in your career. Our benefits include:Flexible and creative work environmentDiverse and collaborative atmosphereProfessional and personal development resourcesOpportunities to volunteer and support charitiesCompetitive salary and benefitsFIS is committed to providing its employees with an exciting career opportunity and competitive compensation. The pay range for this full-time position is $103,010.00 - $173,060.00 and reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for this position based on the posted role, level, and location. Within the range, actual individual starting pay is determined additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Any changes in work location will also impact actual individual starting pay. Please consult with your recruiter about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.Privacy StatementFIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice.EEOC StatementFIS is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics. The EEO is the Law poster is available here supplement document available hereFor positions located in the US, the following conditions apply. If you are made a conditional offer of employment, you will be required to undergo a drug test. However, for Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) purposes, the essential functions of the job may or may not have been described for purposes of ADA reasonable accommodation. title: Sr. Supply Chain Business Analyst, Programmatic
job_description: The primary purpose of this position is to support the Supply Chain teams through data analytics, technology changes, and standard continuous improvement techniques to enhance efficiencies. The position requires a detail-oriented self-starter who has the ability to work across business areas within the Supply Chain departments of Logistics, Paper Services, and Procurement, as well as multiple other Quad teams such as Information Technology, Manufacturing, and Customer Service. title: Analyst II - Digital Product Analytics
company: St. Jude Children's Research Hospital - ALSAC
job_description: At ALSAC you do more than make a living; you make a difference.We like people who are different…because we’re different, too. As one of the world’s most iconic and respected nonprofits, we know what it’s like to stand out. That’s why we’re looking at you. Your background, perspective, and desire to make an impact set you apart. As we work to help St. Jude cure childhood cancer, we're calling on the game-changers, innovators and visionaries to join our family. Not just for the kids of St. Jude, but also for you. Because at ALSAC, we develop and celebrate our employees. So, bring your whole, authentic self and become part of our shared mission: Finding cures. Saving children.®Job DescriptionIf you're passionate about data, thrive in a dynamic environment, and want to make an impact with your expertise, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Help us shape the future of digital products and drive innovation.As an Analyst II - Digital Product Analytics, you will be responsible for specifying, monitoring, gathering, analyzing, and reporting all metrics related to Product initiatives including revenue, reach, and engagement metrics such as conversion rates, web behavior, etc. for the entire digital Product portfolio.Additionally, you will be responsible for Data Mining and Analysis to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies. This role will partner closely with both product and website experience teams.To Be Successful In This Role, You Will NeedStrong Adobe Analytics experience; Adobe Test & Target implementations a plus.Good communication skills and cross-functional, knowledge-sharing attitude.Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Business Analytics or related field, and 3+ years of work experience.Benefits & PerksThe following Benefits & Perks apply to Full-Time Roles Only.We’re dedicated to ensuring children and their families have every opportunity to enjoy life’s special moments. We’re also committed to giving our staff excellent benefits so they can do the same. Core Medical Coverage: (low cost low deductible Medical, Dental, and Vison Insurance plans) 401K Retirement Plan with 7% Employer ContributionExceptional Paid Time OffMaternity / Paternity LeaveInfertility Treatment ProgramAdoption AssistanceEducation AssistanceEnterprise Learning and DevelopmentAnd moreTo ensure the health and safety of the children and families at St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital as well as our donors, volunteers and colleagues, as a condition of employment, we require that employees adhere to ALSAC’s Vaccination Requirements, including COVID-19 Vaccination.ALSAC is an equal employment opportunity employer. ALSAC does not discriminate against any individual with regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, transgender status, disability, veteran status, genetic information or other protected status.No Search FirmsALSAC does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All resumes submitted by search firms to any ALSAC employee or ALSAC representative via email, the internet or in any form and/or method without being contacted and approved by our Employee Experience team and without a valid written search agreement in place will result in no fee being paid if a referred candidate is hired by ALSAC.

title: Oracle Cloud HR/ Benefits Business Analyst
job_description: Title:Oracle Cloud HR/ Benefits Business AnalystLocation: RemoteType: Direct HireLevel: Mid-SeniorDesired Skills & ExperienceExperience implementing Oracle Cloud modules, including the configuration and end-to-end processes.Experience with data conversion and integrations: SDLC lifecycleReporting & Dashboard Analytics using: BI Publisher, OTBIKnowledge of security roles related to modules supported Production support to process transaction in the system. Including, but not limited to: Workforce Structure, workers, Compensation, Open Enrollment, This role is within NRC's Enterprise Solutions Group and will be serving clients nationwide.Why Work Here:Comprehensive Health Benefits & 401k available Consultant Education Reimbursement program Our Core Values: Accountable, Passionate, Respectful, Innovative, and Collaborative National Best and Brightest winner for 2023 Third-Party Recruiting Agencies:New Resources Consulting does not accept unsolicited resumes or candidate submissions of any kind from third-party recruiting firms. Any resumes received from such agencies will be considered the property of New Resources Consulting.

title: Business Systems Solution Analyst – Payroll/HR
job_description: Improving America’s infrastructure isn’t for the weak. It takes grit, determination, and hard work to execute high impact projects. Michels Corporation engages 8,000 people and 18,000 pieces of heavy equipment in our insatiable drive to be the best. Our work improves lives. Find out how a career as a Business Systems Solution Analyst can change yours.As a Business Systems Solution Analyst , your key responsibilities will be to Identify inefficiencies in used processes and/or solutions, act as the internal expert of processes and solutions within assigned functional business department(s)/division(s), and collaboratively identify areas for process and solution improvements.Why Michels? We are consistently ranked among the top 10% of Engineering News-Record’s Top 400 Contractors  Our steady, strategic growth revolves around a commitment to quality  We are family owned and operated  We invest an average of $5,000 per employee on training each year  We reward hard work and dedication with limitless opportunities  We believe it is everyone’s responsibility to promote safety, regardless of job titles.  We offer a comprehensive benefits program, including Health, Dental, Life, Flexible Spending Accounts, Health Savings Account, Short Term and Long-Term Disability Insurance, 401(k) plan, Legal Plan, and Identity Theft and Monitoring Plan. Depending on your positions and location you may participate in a different benefit plan. Why you? You thrive in fast-paced environments under tight deadlines  You relish new challenges and evolving technology  You enjoy collaborating and communicating with your teammates  You like to know your efforts are noticed and appreciated  You possess strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact with all levels of management  You look forward to high-level responsibility opportunities. What It Takes Bachelor’s Degree in related field, 3-5 years of related and/or operational experience, or an equivalent combination  Minimum of 3 years of experience working as a liaison between IT and another business focus, or experience working on large, cross-functional projects  Proficient with Microsoft Office  Competent with Microsoft Visio and Project  Familiar with project management fundamentals (desired)  Familiar with reporting: SQL, Crystal, Dashboards, Pivot charts (desired)  A valid driver license for the type(s) of vehicles you may be driving and an acceptable driving record.  AA/EOE/M/W/Vet/Disability

title: Business Systems Analyst
job_description: Join our team as a Data Analyst and help shape the future of our 100% employee owned company!!Are you passionate about uncovering insights from data? Do you thrive on transforming raw information into actionable strategies? If so, we have an incredible opportunity for you!Kesslers is seeking a talented business systems analyst to join our team and play a pivotal role in our continued success!Position - Business Systems AnalystLocation - Germantown, WIPosition Summary -This position will dive deep into our vast datasets to extract meaningful insights that will fuel our strategic initiatives. This person will work closely with cross-functional teams to identify key business questions and design analytical approaches. This person will also have the unique opportunity to spearhead the implementation of your preferred data visualization tool, empowering you to shape the future of our data infrastructure.Essential Responsibilities -Develop, support, and maintain tools and reports from various platforms and provide user friendly analysis to internal users to support business operations (this may require some programming, troubleshooting, and working with users to address gaps in technology solutions)Advise team members on opportunities to use data to address current business issues.Create and maintain training plans and documentation and/or instructions for internal technology tools and processesDevelop a working understanding of third-party software solution processes and data structures for purposes of reporting and assisting users with business challengesCommunicate technology processes, strategies and implementation plans to internal usersAssist third-party IT solutions partner when needed to manage PC, server, network, security, backup and hardware/software operationsPartner with third-party IT solutions partner to manage users and user rolesAct as a resource for on-site IT supportActively provide and source best practices from a technology perspectiveEngage in other related projects as needed to support business operationsMinimum Qualifications -Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems or similar; or related work experience5 years of experience in a progressive IT roleExperience in reporting and/or data analyst duties including SQL reporting experienceStrong organizational skillsProfessional and supportive communication styles in all formsComfort working independently and within a teamStrong business acumen and understanding of the financial drivers of company performanceAn attitude and commitment to being an active participant of our employee-owned culture

title: Sr. Analyst Sales Analytics
job_description: Why SoftwareOne?What you should know about us:Strip away everything. Strip away our brand, strip away our buildings, strip away our offices. What are we left with? Our people. This is what makes SoftwareOne successful.Passionate people who live and breathe our values every day, who delight our customers, every day, and who go above and beyond, every day. Our culture is unique, and I believe that having the right people, and empowering them to succeed, is the absolute key to our success. -Patrick Winter, Founder.What we expect from our employees:Success at SoftwareOne is not defined by what you do for yourself, but by what you deliver for our customers, the business and for the employees around you. SoftwareOne employees are energized, agile and are laser focused on delivering world class Customer Satisfaction and results. Our leaders motivate and inspire their teams and provide a working environment that delivers incredible levels of Employee Satisfaction. We are Humble, have a very high degree of Integrity and are simply not interested in politics. Our leaders operate with a high level of Discipline but are able to work at Speed manage change in a global economy.  At SoftwareOne, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.   Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. “With employee satisfaction as one of our core values, we are passionate about diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all of our employees. We want every employee to have the greatest experience of their career.” The roleFor over 30 years, SoftwareOne has been the foundation for organizations worldwide for their technology solutions. With changes in the market from on-premises to cloud, we have always been one step ahead. Underpinning our transitions and evolutions are our seven core values, which we expect from all our current employees and look for in our future colleagues. The global nature of our organization allows us to adapt and commit to these values unique to each location's culture and business needs.Job SummarySoftwareOne is seeking a proven analyst to join our team and help drive our growth agenda. This role will leverage the analyst's strategic thinking capabilities and insights to identify short- and long-term growth opportunities based on a comprehensive understanding of the industry, the portfolio mix, and customer strategies.You’ll be pivotal in leveraging diverse analytics tools to extract meaningful insights and drive strategic business decisions. Your expertise will be crucial in interpreting complex data to enhance our sales strategies and propel growth initiatives forward. The role is highly visible across sales leadership.Sr. Analyst, North America Sales Analytics is a member of the Revenue Intelligence team and reports to the Director, Revenue Intelligence.Roles And ResponsibilitiesWhat you’ll do (including, but not limited to):Analyze go-to-market performance to reveal effectiveness against objectives. Translate the results to build strategic and tactical recommendations through strong data storytelling.Provide insights and offer actionable recommendations in identifying trends, metrics, behaviors, and characteristics to improve retention, acquisition, and pipeline goals.Examine sales metrics to identify cause-effect relationships between sales actions and outcomes.Support the sales forecasting and quota-setting process, leveraging internal and external data based on sales territories, portfolio, and segmentation. Must ensure a high level of accuracy and quality in the pipeline.Provide specific support and guidance to Sales Directors and the sales teams as they interact with our reporting suite to ensure they derive the right insights and actions from those KPIs. Provide analysis and insight to drive business outcomes.Recommend enhancements to existing dashboards and reports that visualize and track performance indicators, trends, and behaviors.Develop data assets and views that can be leveraged for planning and target setting within the Sales Operations team.Elevate the role of data within the North American organization and assist in developing an analytics roadmap.Assist with training and mentoring other Analysts.What We Offer Generous base pay with healthy bonus structure that includes accelerators. Independent environment without a lot of red tape where you are empowered to make decisions. Full suite of medical coverage with A+ carriers, Dental and Vision with strong employer contributions Additional voluntary coverage available for Pet, Identity Theft Protection, Accident & Critical Illness 401k program with employer matching 50% up to the first 10% of employee’s contributions Wellness plan that includes credits to premiums and employer contributions towards savings plan of your choice Access to EAP and concierge services Pre-Paid Legal at no cost Plentiful PTO that includes paid holidays, floating holidays, your birthday off, a volunteer day, and vacation time Employee stock purchase plan Learning and development opportunities galore Tuition reimbursement And much more! Specific to Milwaukee-based office employees: company paid parking. Winning culture, inclusive environment, and friendly people all over the world As a culture first organization, being together is how we learn and grow. We come together in-person at least 3 days for collaboration, support, and to have some fun. Where there is no physical location, we give all our employees an equal cultural experience through a remote setting.The preceding job profile has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by associates within this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required. Additional duties may be assigned and may be subject to change at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons.This role has a market-competitive salary and an anticipated base compensation range. Actual salaries will vary depending on a candidate’s experience, qualifications, skills, and location. This role is also eligible for a performance-based bonus.Targeted comps will be a mix of base and bonus: 90,000-135,000 USDWe are not able to consider candidates residing in the state of Hawaii currently.What You’ll BringWhat we need to see from you5+ years of analytical experience, preferably in the technology or software industries.Proven experience with the development and implementation of revenue reporting and forecasting. Understanding of sales processes and pipeline management.Proven experience in data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI or Tableau) to communicate insights effectively.Proficient in Microsoft Office (e.g., Excel, PowerPoint, Word)Strong analytical and critical thinking skills. Ability to identify trends, interpret data, and communicate recommendations based on results.Analytical rigor and detail orientation to ensure accuracy and credibility of insights.Effective communicator with strong interpersonal skills that will drive collaboration across the team and organization.Knowledge of advanced analytics, statistical analysis (i.e., regression, clustering, time series), machine learning, and predictive analytics.Must be a highly motivated self-starter who can work independently and thrives on multi-tasking in a fast-paced work environment.Education:Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics.Job FunctionSales

title: Corporate Development Analyst
job_description: At Northwestern Mutual, we are strong, innovative and growing. We invest in our people. We care and make a positive difference. The Corporate Development Analyst is responsible for providing complex financial analysis as a member of Northwestern Mutual’s Venture and Corporate Development team. The Corporate Development Analyst will assist in evaluating potential transactions by building financial models, developing business cases for acquisitions and strategic partnerships, leading external research, and assisting with due diligence and integration efforts. In addition, the Corporate Development Analyst will support the planning and execution of business development activities across Northwestern Mutual.Responsibilities Build detailed financial models and create valuation analyses using multiple techniques including comparable company, comparable transaction, and discounted cash flow analyses.  Develop business cases for acquisitions and partnerships through quantitative and qualitative analyses. Deliverables may include models, memos, written presentations, and oral presentations delivered to senior business leaders.  Partner with business leaders and teammates to proactively evaluate opportunities that accelerate execution of Northwestern Mutual’s multi-year strategy.  Support transactions team with due diligence, negotiation, and integration planning efforts.  Monitor and research financial services industry mergers, acquisitions and partnership trends for insights and comparative analysis. Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities Four-year undergraduate degree in accounting, economics, finance or mathematics and a history of academic excellence.  One to three years of prior experience in accounting, banking, consulting, finance, or insurance industries.  Proficiency in accounting and strong financial modeling skills.  Demonstrated ability to evaluate and interpret financial data and other technical information.  Demonstrated superior written and verbal communication skills with ability to build rapport and gain acceptance at all levels of an organization. title: Senior Analyst, Commercial Analytics & Pricing
job_description: As part of the Thermo Fisher Scientific team, you’ll discover meaningful work that makes a positive impact on a global scale. Join our colleagues in bringing our Mission to life every single day to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We provide our global teams with the resources needed to achieve individual career goals while helping to take science a step beyond by developing solutions for some of the world’s toughest challenges, like protecting the environment, making sure our food is safe or helping find cures for cancer.Location/Division Specific InformationPittsburgh, PA / Analytical Instrument Group (AIG)How will you make an impact?You will play a pivotal role focusing on improving commercial analytics and pricing capabilities for AIG. The role's responsibilities encompass the development of sophisticated analytics, tools, and dashboards crafted to furnish insightful business intelligence, facilitating informed decision-making processes for the AIG commercial teams.The ideal candidate will provide a blend of robust technical competence and hands-on experience with large data sets, complemented by excellent communication and partnership aptitudes, enabling effective interactions with complementary teams. This role presents an outstanding opportunity for aspirational talents to deepen their grasp of data science, business intelligence, and the intricacies of commercial management in a highly visible setting.What will you do?Collaborate with Division Commercial and Finance teams to develop advanced data analytics, models, and dashboards to derive insights, monitor commercial performances, and assess funnel health.Leverage data analytics/science tools (e.g., gene.ai) to empower commercial teams in identifying new leads, cross-selling opportunities, and market trend shifts.Translate business challenges and opportunities into quantitative analyses to uncover actionable patterns and insights!Provide expertise in price setting, discount adjustments, and promotion design, ensuring thoughtful tradeoffs between price and volume to drive share gain and volume uptick.Deliver regular pricing reports and implement tools to guide business partners in making informed decisions, while analyzing market trends, opportunities, and risks.Lead business reviews emphasizing pricing insights and strategies, ensuring efficient market positioning and potential improvements.Ensure data quality and readiness, handling tasks like data clean-up, integration, transformation, and validation.Collaborate with business partners and D&T teams to establish robust data pipelines catering to diverse analytics needs, and further a data-driven decision-making culture.Craft use cases, develop mock-ups, and refine tools based on iterative business feedback. Lead all aspects of user acceptance testing (UAT), tool demos, and training sessions.How will you get here?EducationBS or MS Degree in Finance, Business, Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science or related disciplineExperience5+ years of work experience in data analytics, business intelligence, finance, commercial analytics, or related fieldStrong analytical and problem-solving skills, and experience of building in depth data/financial modelsProficiency in Excel, SQL, and Power BI. Python experience preferred but not requiredStrong presentation skills and ability to articulate sophisticated data models and business problemsAbility to work across a matrix org structure and influence business partnersSelf-motivated, able to drive actions to completion with intensity and ownershipPassionate about learning business and dataProven ability to prioritize and self-direct workload, influence others and manage time independently.Ability to travel (10%)This position has not been approved for relocation assistance.BenefitsWe offer competitive remuneration, annual incentive plan bonus, healthcare, and a range of employee benefits. Thermo Fisher Scientific offers employment with an innovative, forward-thinking organization, and outstanding career and development prospects. We offer an exciting company culture that stands for integrity, intensity, involvement, and innovation!Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Watch as our colleagues explain 5 reasons to work with us. As one team of 100,000+ colleagues, we share a common set of values - Integrity, Intensity, Innovation and Involvement - working together to accelerate research, solve complex scientific challenges, drive technological innovation and support patients in need. #StartYourStory at Thermo Fisher Scientific, where diverse experiences, backgrounds and perspectives are valued.Apply today! http://jobs.thermofisher.comThermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.Accessibility/Disability AccessJob Seekers with a Disability: Thermo Fisher Scientific offers accessibility service for job seekers requiring accommodations in the job application process. For example, this may include individuals requiring assistance because of hearing, vision, mobility, or cognitive impairments. If you are a job seeker with a disability, or assisting a person with a disability, and require accessibility assistance or an accommodation to apply for one of our jobs, please submit a request by telephone at 1-855-471-2255*. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.This telephone line is reserved solely for job seekers with disabilities requiring accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Messages left for other purposes, such as not being able to get into the career website, following up on an application, or other non-disability related technical issues will not receive a response.Compensation And BenefitsThe salary range estimated for this position based in Pennsylvania is $84,400.00–$120,000.00.This position may also be eligible to receive a variable annual bonus based on company, team, and/or individual performance results in accordance with company policy. We offer a comprehensive Total Rewards package that our U.S. colleagues and their families can count on, which includes:A choice of national medical and dental plans, and a national vision plan, including health incentive programsEmployee assistance and family support programs, including commuter benefits and tuition reimbursementAt least 120 hours paid time off (PTO), 10 paid holidays annually, paid parental leave (3 weeks for bonding and 8 weeks for caregiver leave), accident and life insurance, and short- and long-term disability in accordance with company policyRetirement and savings programs, such as our competitive 401(k) U.S. retirement savings planEmployees’ Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) offers eligible colleagues the opportunity to purchase company stock at a discountFor more information on our benefits, please visit: https://jobs.thermofisher.com/global/en/total-rewards

title: Sr Analyst, Marketing Analytics

Process and synthesize complex data and ensure data integrity and accuracy.Proactively anticipates needs of the customer and delivers quality results independently.Actively coaches and mentors junior team members.Independent and objective thinking to properly evaluate, communicate, educate, influence, and gain cooperation in reaching consensus, decisions, and action.Results orientated and strong initiative; convey a sense of urgency and drives issues to closure.Ability to positively contribute and adapt to change and operate in a dynamic organization.Excellent organizational skills and detail orientation.Strong analytical skills, business intuition, and ability to build consensus across functions.Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, ability to operate in a matrixed cross-cultural and cross-functional environment.Excellent verbal and written skills with the ability to present to, and communicate with, Senior Leadership.Adaptable, open to change and able to work in ambiguous situations and respond to new information or unexpected circumstances.Creative and proactive problem-solving abilities.Uphold company mission and values through accountability, innovation, integrity, quality, and teamwork.Support and comply with the company’s Quality Management System policies and procedures.Regular and reliable attendance.Ability to work on a mobile device, tablet, or in front of a computer screen and/or perform typing for approximately 90% of a typical working day.Ability and means to travel between Madison locations.Ability to travel 5% of working time away from work location, may include overnight/weekend travel.Minimum QualificationsBachelor's degree in Math, Business, Computer Science, Engineering, or other field related to the essential duties.3+ years of relevant business experience, or advanced degree, or professional certifications.Proficient in Microsoft Office; especially Excel.Demonstrated ability to apply qualitative or quantitative business analysis while leveraging primary or secondary data.Demonstrated ability to manage and leverage multiple data sources.Demonstrated ability to perform the Essential Duties of the position with or without accommodation.Authorization to work in the United States without sponsorship.Preferred QualificationsBiotech or Pharmaceutical industry experience.Experience working with or within a Commercial Organization.Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, R, Python, or similar.Expertise in data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.).Excellent communication skills to convey complex findings to non-technical stakeholders.Proven ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.Salary Range:$85,000.00 - $135,000.00The annual base salary shown is for this position located in US - WI - Madison on a full-time basis. In addition, this position is bonus eligible, and is eligible to receive company stock upon hire as well as annually.Exact Sciences is proud to offer an employee experience that includes paid time off (including days for vacation, holidays, volunteering, and personal time), paid leave for parents and caregivers, a retirement savings plan, wellness support, and health benefits including medical, prescription drug, dental, and vision coverage. title: Senior Supply Chain Forecast Analyst
job_description: Join The #1 Furniture Company-Join The #1 Furniture BrandAshley Furniture Industries, Inc. is the largest manufacturer of furniture in the world. Established in 1945, Ashley offers one of the industry’s broadest product assortments to retail partners in 123 countries.Summary The Forecast Analyst will forecast groups by product category. This position is responsible for an average amount of forecast dollars and/or records and has a significant financial impact on departments and the organization. The Forecast Analyst is responsible for accurately forecasting products utilizing a statistical forecast system requiring strong mathematical skills. This position is also responsible for ensuring high customer satisfaction rates while maintaining adequate inventory levels at each distribution center location. The Forecast Analyst will use multiple methods and tools to evaluate past sales history, future customer demand, customer placements and seasonality trends. This position will communicate with a wide variety of internal and external customers to negotiate and make recommendations to fulfill customer demands while ensuring a reasonable inventory level plan. The Forecast Analyst is accountable for meeting goals and objectives to maintain the company’s growth rate as well as evaluating processes for continual improvement.Primary Job Functions Analyze, update, and monitor the forecast for accuracy using a statistical forecast system and communicate changes to appropriate departments. Forecast groups by product category. Evaluate and monitor future orders versus forecast; make forecast changes when needed. Create and maintain product journals. Responsible for an average amount of forecast dollars and/or records. Independently make decisions to change and update forecasts and selling relationships by comparing future forecasts to actual history, and percentage of change in demand following standard operating procedures and established guidelines. Identify out-of-the-norm conditions on any product and communicate to management; make recommendations for solution. Interact and build relationships with key business partners to ensure accurate data and forecasting. Identify process improvement opportunities. Take initiative and provide effective leadership, promote teamwork, and demonstrate the ability to lead people to get results. Evaluate inventory and the reliability of the supply chain flow for approval of Ad Notice, promotional requests and customer projections to ensure customer satisfaction and product availability. Enter additional demand into the statistical forecast system; closely monitor current and future inventory levels. Provide directions for expediting orders when necessary and ensure proper inventory levels are available. Identify planned drop items and/or groups; evaluate and make recommendation for best time frame for drop based upon remaining finished goods inventory, raw material inventory on hand and/or at vendor locations. Negotiate with Production, Purchasing and/or vendor regarding the final run dates and provide direction for expediting, deferring and/or cancelling orders when necessary and ensure proper inventory levels are available. Recommend excess inventory items to be added to the Hot Buys develop a plan and make recommendations for closing out remaining inventory. Contribute to the planning of long- and short-term business objectives; actively participate in product review meetings and Integrated Business Planning (IBP) meetings as required. Positively and professionally represent the company when handling complaints and resolving issues when a product is in limited supply, customer orders are delayed, or product is in excess.Job QualificationsEducation: Bachelor’s degree in business or related field, or equivalent work experience, RequiredExperience 5 plus years’ experience in supply chain fields, Preferred. Licenses or Certification: Certified Professional Forecaster (CPF) certificate - Preferred APICS/ASCM – CPIM, CSCP (Certified Supply Chain Professional) - Preferred Six Sigma Green Belt – PreferredKnowledge, Skills And Abilities Supply Chain System knowledge. Working knowledge of Continuous Improvement Handle mathematical calculations with speed and accuracy. Strong attention to detail and accuracy Effective time management and organizational skills Analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent interpersonal skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills Maintain confidentiality. Handle multiple projects simultaneously within established time constraints. Proficient computer skills, including experience with Microsoft Office Suite, especially MS Excel; internet. Respond professionally in situations with difficult employee/vendor/customer issues or inquiries. Perform under strong demands in a fast-paced environment. Work independently as well as in a team environment. Display empathy, understanding and patience with employees and external customers.Physical Effort And Work Environment Lifting: Must be able to lift and carry objects up to 25 lbs. Pulling/Pushing: Will transport loads of up to 40 lbs. Work Environment: Predominately in an office environment; not substantially exposed to adverse conditions.Apply today and find your home at Ashley!Benefits We Offer Health, Dental, Vision, Employee Assistance Program Paid Vacation, Holidays, and Your Birthday off Generous Employee Discount on home furnishings Professional Development Opportunities Ashley Wellness Centers (location specific) and Medical Tourism Telehealth 401(k) and Profit Sharing Life InsuranceOur Core Values Honesty & Integrity Passion, Drive, Discipline Continuous Improvement/Operational Excellence Dirty Fingernail Growth Focused To learn more about Ashley Furniture, our community engagement programs, environmental stewardship, and our core values, please visit our Corporate Social Responsibility information page: Corporate Social Responsibility We are an equal opportunity employer and provide a drug-free working environment. title: Analyst I, Benefit Configuration-Remote
job_description: Putting People First in Pharmacy- Navitus was founded as an alternative to traditional pharmacy benefit manager (PBM) models. We are committed to removing cost from the drug supply chain to make medications more affordable for the people who need them. At Navitus, our team members work in an environment that celebrates diversity, fosters creativity and encourages growth. We welcome new ideas and share a passion for excellent service to our customers and each other.We are unable to offer remote work to residents of Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, New Hampshire, New Mexico, North Dakota, Rhode Island, South Carolina, South Dakota, West Virginia, and Wyoming.The Analyst I, Benefit Configuration position is responsible for analysis, interpretation, integration and business decisions with regards to hierarchy, pharmacy network rates and Navitus’ formulary configuration designs. This position requires knowledge of both the technical and operational sides of the business utilizing Navitus’ adjudication system (NaviClaimRx) and/or other applications which includes software updates and enhancements.The Analyst I, Benefit Configuration will work closely with Provider Relations, Formulary Services and Client Services to understand the interdependence of each team pertaining to claims adjudication and client reporting needs. This position will ensure Navitus is able to provide a versatile adjudication system that allows for various benefit designs and accurate claim adjudication to adapt to the continuous changes in the pharmacy benefit industry.Is this you? Find out more below!How do I make an impact on my team?Analyze and implement requests including adjudication hierarchy, pharmacy network rates and formulary management configuration with a high degree of accuracyImport and validate Member Prior Authorization loads for new client implementations along with formulary updates for existing clientsPerform quality assurance peer reviews on adjudication hierarchy, pharmacy network and formulary management configuration changes with a high degree of accuracy consistent with department work standardsServes as first line of support to troubleshoot adjudication inquiries to internal and external customersAccountable for pharmacy network rate build resolution and impact assessmentIs responsible for complying with departmental standards along with established turnaround timesUpdate and maintain existing departmental policies and proceduresComply with standards set forth regarding benefit design and configuration including HIPAA, NCPDP and Navitus internal business standardsUtilize departmental workflow management, issue resolution and reporting toolsContribute towards departmental performance and service level guarantees and achieve individual performance goals around accuracy and timelinessWhat our team expects from you? Associates degree and/or a minimum of four years of work experience is required. Two years of pharmacy technician experience is preferredKnowledge of NCPDP or Medispan is a plusParticipate in, adhere to, and support compliance program objectivesThe ability to consistently interact cooperatively and respectfully with other employeesWhat can you expect from Navitus?Hours/Location: Monday-Friday 8:00am-5:00pm, CST-RemotePaid Volunteer HoursEducational Assistance Plan and Professional Membership assistanceReferral Bonus Program – up to $750!Top of the industry benefits for Health, Dental, and Vision insurance, Flexible Spending Account, Paid Time Off, Eight paid holidays, 401K, Short-term and Long-term disability, College Savings Plan, Paid Parental Leave, Adoption Assistance Program, and Employee Assistance Program
