title: Product Owner - Asset Management (Hybrid)
job_description: Securian Financial Groups internal position title is Product Consultant.Position SummaryAs a Product Owner, you will collaborate with Enterprise Technology, Data & Analytics, and key stakeholders to maximize data and technology experiences within Securian Asset Management (SAM). You will utilize a blend of business and technology knowledge to lead the optimization of Back Office systems, support strategic projects, define business requirements, and oversee vendor relations. You will report to a Product Manager and collaborate with fellow Product Owners on the Investment Product Roadmap execution. If you are a customer-focused innovator committed to consistently delivering exceptional results, this position could be for you!Responsibilities Include But Not Limited ToServe as Product Owner for Back Office systems (Clearwater, PLM, Bloomberg), leading optimization and remediation efforts with an initial focus on Clearwater and PLM.Collaborate with business stakeholders and agile Technology and Data & Analytics teams to document requirements, design goals, and develop solutions.Act as a liaison between technology and business, translating functional requirements to technical specifications, and work with external vendors to address system issues and optimize solutions.Identify product opportunities and drive the necessary discovery and research to optimize SLAs.Help manage and maintain a SAM Technology Needs inventory.Drive prioritized project execution that aligns with the product vision and roadmap, while maintaining continuous communication with the Product Manager and fellow Product Owners.Partner with senior leaders to provide executive updates and validate business objectives.Monitor industry, competitive, software, and data trends to influence strategy and product planning.Qualifications3-5+ years of investment-related experience, with a deep understanding of Front Office / Middle Office / Back Office functions in asset management.2+ years' experience as a product owner or product manager on a technology product, or 3+ years as a Product Analyst.Familiar with Agile software development methodology.Skilled in prioritizing multiple, complex projects in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.Strong analytical abilities with attention to detail and accuracy.Capable of building trust-based relationships and effective teamwork.Excellent communication skills, able to engage at all organizational levels.Experience in customer engagement for problem understanding and feedback incorporation into product design.Innovative approach to meeting customer needs in collaboration with technology and data teams.Proven track record of managing products from strategic planning to tactical execution.Ability to influence technology teams to enhance customer experience without direct authority.**This position will be in a hybrid working arrangement.**Securian Financial believes in hybrid work as an integral part of our culture.Associates get the benefit of working both virtually and in our offices. If you're in a commutable distance (90 minutes) you'll join us 2-3 days each week in our offices to collaborate and build relationships. Our policy allows flexibility for the reality of business and personal schedules. When working in our offices at least two days per week isn't feasible (vacations, illness, travel, etc.), an eight day per month standard is an option.Physical Job RequirementsAbility to utilize the keyboard, computer and/or mouse for up to 8 hours per day. Ability to work at least 40 hours per week. Ability to utilize the phone and/or virtual meeting platform for 1-4 hours per day. The physical job requirements described above are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of jobs.Paid Time OffBe you. With us. At Securian Financial, we understand that attracting top talent means offering more than just a job - it means providing a rewarding and fulfilling career. As a valued member of our high-performing team, we want you to connect with your work, your relationships and your community. Enjoy our comprehensive range of benefits designed to enhance your professional growth, well-being and work-life balance, including the advantages listed here:We want you to take time off for what matters most to you. During your first year of hire, you receive a prorated bank of personal days and vacation time depending on your month of hire. Leave programs: Securian's flexible leave programs allow time off from work for parental leave, caregiver leave for family members, bereavement and military leave.Company-funded pension plan and a 401(k) retirement plan: Share in the success of our company. Securian's 401(k) company contribution is tied to our performance up to 10 percent of eligible earnings, with a target of 5 percent. The amount is based on company results compared to goals related to earnings, sales and service.Health insurance: From the first day of employment, associates and their eligible family members - including spouses, domestic partners and children - are eligible for medical, dental and vision coverage.Volunteer time: We know the importance of community. Through company-sponsored events, volunteer paid time off, a dollar-for-dollar matching gift program and more, we encourage you to support organizations important to you.Associate Resource Groups: Build connections, be yourself and develop meaningful relationships at work through associate-led ARGs. Dedicated groups focus on a variety of interests and affinities, including:Mental Wellness and DisabilityPride at Securian FinancialSecurian Young Professionals NetworkSecurian Multicultural NetworkSecurian Women and Allies NetworkServicemember Associate Resource GroupFor more information regarding Securian's benefits, please review our Benefits page.This information is not intended to explain all the provisions of coverage available under these plans. In all cases, the plan document dictates coverage and provisions.Securian Financial Group, Inc. does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital or familial status, pregnancy, disability, genetic information, political affiliation, veteran status, status in regard to public assistance or any other protected status. job_description: Job Description We have an immediate opening at the Department of Employee Trust Funds (ETF) for a Business/Systems Analyst to participate in our Data Management Program. Creating and maintaining source to target (S2T) documentation – 5 years Develop complex SQL - 5 years Gather requirements and develop user stories – 5 years Translate business requirements into technical specifications – 5 years Perform root cause analysis for systems and perform data analysis with complex datasets to identify patterns, trends, and insights – 5 years Plan and execute rigorous testing procedures to ensure system functionality, performance, and reliability. Perform data reconciliation and analysis of results. Conduct user acceptance testing and collaborate with stakeholders to resolve any issues or defects. – 2 yearsDesired SkillsNice to Have (Preferred) Skills: Performing gap analysis and cost benefit analysis Mentoring and training users on business and systems analysis methodology Experience with data quality tools and frameworks Experience with business intelligence platforms Experience with data governance including security and privacy policies Eliciting and refining requirements for dashboards Strong understanding of different types of data models Creating comprehensive documentation, including system requirements, design specifications, and user manuals. title: Warehouse Supervisor
company: WAXIE Sanitary Supply, An Envoy Solutions Company
job_description: OverviewEnvoy Solutions, a diversified distribution company with over $1.5 billion in revenue, is bringing together leading brands from the facility supplies, packaging solutions, and specialty products industries. Our portfolio of companies includes Royal Corporation, North American, WAXIE, SEPG, Daycon, North Woods, PJP, and NVISION.We’ve combined the expertise of local consultants and sales teams with a wider portfolio of products and deeper category knowledge. We work both nationally and regionally to ensure responsiveness to the industry’s toughest challenges, and we deliver a more efficient and streamlined distribution model on behalf of our customers.Responsible for recommendations and execution of procedures involving shipping and receiving, inventory and all aspects of warehouse procedures. Institute and enforce safety programs and guidelines.Essential Duties Schedule receiving with vendors and trucking companies.  People are receiving properly in accordance with company guidelines.  PO.'s and packing slips are matched, differences are reported to Purchasing and Inventory Analyst.  Items received are counted in accordance with P.O. and packing slip.  Merchandise is checked for damage; if damaged, refuse and notify Purchasing and Inventory Analyst.  Insure special order items are marked and placed in special area for same.  ARC's are in salable condition, unless indicated; for special order items - notify Purchasing.  Stock merchandise in accordance with inventory listing. Administer row-bin-tier accuracy.  Maintain a neat and clean warehouse.  Ship in accordance with new hazardous material requirements and laws.  Enclose properly labeled to and from packing slip.  Denote COD shipping and payment COD.  Routing software process learned/performed within 90 days of hire  Utilize least expensive transportation (commensurate with good business practices) when shipping merchandise by common carrier. Inventory Work with Inventory Analyst and Purchasing to verify accurate cycle counts as inventory control. Safety Ensure all safety equipment is used and maintained in working order.  Ensure all day shift warehouse employees are wearing proper safety shoes and uniforms.  Ensure safety belts are worn while working.  Attend and participate in all safety meetings.  Ensure all fire extinguishers are in working order and have been inspected on an annual basis.  Work with safety coordinator on the implementation and training of all safety policies and guidelines.  Ensure safety inspection report is turned in every Monday.  Store toxic materials separately i.e. bleach and ammonia. Personnel Select, train, direct and motivate employees; appraise performance and recommend salary actions for subordinates to assure a stable and competent organization.  Work as a team with Warehouse Supervisor (nights) and Delivery and Service Supervisor and provides relief as necessary during their absence.  Participate as a member of the Division Management Team. Building Hazards Fire hazards; knowledge of fire equipment.  Proper storage. Building Security Doors latch properly.  Exit doors open properly.  All lock-up personnel are familiar with guidelines. Qualifications Prior supervisory or lead experience (distribution and warehousing environment preferred).  Excellent verbal and written communication skills with strong interpersonal skills.  Strong analytical skills with proficiency level in Microsoft Word and Excel.  Previous AS400 (Aplus) experience is preferred.  Ability to multi-task.  Must be able to obtain company forklift license (company to provide training).  High school diploma or equivalent required. This position offers a competitive starting salary and comprehensive benefits program.Envoy Solutions (and its subsidiaries) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. This means that we consider all applicants for employment and employees eligible for employment without regard to race, marital status or civil union status, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, mental or physical disability, sexual orientation and/or any other characteristic protected by law. We also provide reasonable accommodations to our applicants and employees with disabilities in order to assist them in the performance of their essential job functions.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
job_description: Continental Properties is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team at our home office in Menomonee Falls, WI. As the Business Intelligence Analyst, you will develop business intelligence solutions integrating operational and business data in the warehouse and transforming it to achieve valuable insights. You will report to the Director of Business Analytics.    We are embracing a hybrid work environment, and you can work both in the office and remotely.    Essential Responsibilities: Gather business requirements, designs, and develop Business Intelligence Data Model projects in a Microsoft environment using SQL Server technologies and/or Power BI.  Analyze companywide reports and draft business insights that will help our Senior Leadership with strategic decision making.   Develop business intelligence solutions, including corporate performance dashboards, organization-wide reports, and departmental analytics Design data pipelines for warehousing, BI reporting, and analytics using DBT and PowerBI from database, file, and API sources using DataOps methodologies.  Be a resource for data users in the organization and assist business users with technical tasks including data extracts, report creation, SQL, and general data system troubleshooting.   Skills for Success: Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, or similar quantitative field preferred. 2 years in an analytics role preferred. Experience with data visualization software, Microsoft Power BI Tableau, Qlik, or BI tool  Experience in database management systems, Microsoft SQL, MySQL, OracleDB or other   What Sets Us Apart:Continental Properties is a great place to work, as evidenced by our consecutive Top Workplace awards. Here are some of the reasons that our team members vote for us as a Top Workplace:A company culture that encourages innovation and empowers team members to act as leaders by providing the opportunities, training, and tools essential to achieving a successful and meaningful careerIndustry-leading compensation and benefits package including Medical, Dental, and Vision Plan options, flexible spending accounts for medical and dependent care reimbursement, 401(k) with company match and company provided life and disability insuranceAn excellent work environment with potential for long-term growth in the industry, paid professional memberships and professional activities (conferences and workshops) and a tuition and certification reimbursement programPaid holidays and lucrative vacation time; half days on Fridays during designated monthsParticipation in our Building Above and Beyond (BAAB) incentive program that rewards team members based on the success of the company as measured against clearly defined goalsFor team members who are interested, informal offsite gatherings and company sponsored lunches on a monthly basis6-weeks paid parental leave with family-forming & fertility benefits (up to 12-weeks for birth mothers) On-demand mental health support and an employee assistance programYou Belong Here Committee focused on promoting and inclusive and equitable work environment We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.We comply with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), and all applicable state and local fair employment practices laws, and are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals with disabilities.For the benefit of our residents, the communities we serve, and our co-workers, all applicants are required to pass a post-offer criminal background check prior to joining the Continental team.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
job_description: *LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY** U.S. CITIZENS or PERMANENT RESIDENTS ONLY*** This is not a 100% remote position – we value collaboration, and we believe it is best done across the table than across the screen. ABOUT US: Wis-Pak is a leading manufacturer and distributor of Pepsi-Cola and other popular beverage brands. We are a billion-dollar organization offering ample opportunities to drive change, innovate processes, and help shape our company’s future direction. As we continue to expand, we intend to integrate more data-driven decision-making across our operations. To support this vision, we are seeking a proactive and adaptable Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst to join our team.ABOUT YOU:Do you aspire to leverage the power of data to influence business outcomes? Are you an analytical thinker and creative problem solver? Can you translate complex data into easy-to-understand terms that will enable better business decisions? Are you a curious learner? Are you comfortable working in evolving business conditions and a fast-paced environment? We are looking for someone who is not afraid to ask critical questions and challenge conventional thinking. Can you work independently, with strong personal accountability?ABOUT THE JOB:As a BI Analyst, you will play a critical role in shaping the landscape of data utilization within the company. This is a dynamic position within a developing area of our business which means your responsibilities and projects will evolve over time. The ideal candidate will thrive in ambiguous situations, demonstrating a strong ability to adapt and innovate as the role and its demands change.WHAT YOU’LL DO:Develop, implement, and maintain BI solutions (reports, dashboards, data models) that enhance decision-making and business performance across various departments.Collaborate with stakeholders to identify business requirements and opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.Analyze large datasets to provide actionable insights and recommendations that address complex business questions.Manage the lifecycle of BI projects from conceptualization to deployment, ensuring adherence to timelines and quality standards.Continuously improve BI tools, systems, and processes through feedback and detailed ongoing analysis.Provide training and support to business users to maximize the utilization of BI technology.Stay updated with industry trends and advancements in BI technologies to suggest and implement best practices.WHAT YOU’LL BRING TO THE TABLE:Bachelor’s degree in information technology, computer science, data science or business administration1 to 3 years of experience as a BI Analyst, Data Analyst, or similar role in a data-driven environmentStrong proficiency with Power BI or Tableau (SQL a plus)Advanced Excel skills a MUSTExperience in data modeling, data analysis, and data visualizationAbility to communicate complex concepts to non-technical usersWHAT WE OFFER:A dynamic role with room to grow and shape the future of our organizationOpportunity to work with a diverse, cross-functional team that values innovation and creativityCompetitive payComprehensive benefitsFlexible work schedule that supports work-life balanceUp for the challenge? Apply here: https://go.cultureindex.com/p/wsnPp8toICk4b9uICWe look forward to discovering how you will make a difference and help us achieve new heights in the industry.

title: Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst - Artificial Intelligence (AI) focus
job_description: Are you passionate about leveraging data-driven insights to shape strategic initiatives and drive organizational growth? AMSOIL is looking for a technical and strategic-minded Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team. We're seeking an individual with a keen focus on artificial intelligence to drive operational efficiency and decision-making through advanced analytics and AI integration. Our ideal candidate is passionate about uncovering valuable data insights and possesses a strong drive to utilize technology for automating and streamlining processes within the organization. This position offers a hybrid work schedule requiring a minimum of 2 days a week in the office located in Superior, Wisconsin. Core Responsibilities:  Collaborate with Stakeholders to understand their business information needs and formulate data-driven solutions.  Working with department leaders to assess opportunities for AI integration to enhance operations, automate processes, and improve overall employee productivity.  Participate in the development efforts designed to create solutions and tools to collect, process, analyze and disseminate reliable, actionable information to the organization.  Design, develop, and maintain scalable, automated, user-friendly systems, reports, dashboards, etc., that support our analytical and business needs.  Use advanced analytics techniques to gather and analyze large datasets to solve complex problems and provide actionable insights.  Ensure data accuracy and integrity by implementing quality controls and validation processes.  Define and design secure in-house AI models and algorithms to analyze data, automate processes, enhance productivity, and support strategic initiatives.  Stay abreast of industry trends and advancements in BI and AI technologies, applying this knowledge to enhance data analysis and the decision-making processes.  Drive continuous improvement by seeking feedback, analyzing performance metrics, and identifying areas for optimization.  Position Requirements:  Bachelor’s degree in computer science, data science, mathematics, statistics, business analysis, or equivalent work experience.  5 or more years of experience as a BI Analyst, Data Analyst, or similar role, with a strong focus on analytics and problem-solving.  Skilled in using R, Python or SQL to manipulate data and create actionable insights from large data sets.  Proficiency with data visualization tools and BI/AI platforms (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI, Microsoft BI Stack, ChatGPT, and MS Copilot).  Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, including pivot tables, reports, and charts.  Preferred Requirements:  Proficiency in data warehouse analysis and MS SQL Server development, including ETL processes (SSIS), reporting tools (SSRS), analysis cubes (SSAS), stored procedures, views, triggers, functions, and query optimization.  Experience with predictive models, machine-learning algorithms, and AI language models.  Benefits:  Paid time off and paid holidays each year  Employee bonus program  401(k) with company match  Paid life, short-term disability, and long-term disability insurance  Competitive health benefits  Health savings account (HSA) and flexible spending account (FSA) options  Affordable group dental, vision, critical illness, and accident insurance  Employee discount on product  Corporate gym membership If you have any questions or need assistance with the application process, please email: humanresources@amsoil.comEqual Opportunity Employer/Veterans/DisabledAMSOIL is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Employment policies and decisions on employment and promotion are based on merit, qualifications, performance and business needs. The decisions and criteria governing the employment relationship with all employees are made in a nondiscriminatory manner, without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity , age, marital status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, veteran status or any other factor determined to be unlawful by federal, state or local statutes.Apply Now

title: JDE Business Systems Analyst
job_description: SUMMARYThe JDE Business Systems Analyst will be responsible for providing technology support to improve business process workflow efficiencies, application solutions and increase end-users knowledge of business system applications. This position will work closely with Sartori Company business resources, business analysts and programmers to deliver quality Business System solutions that meet or exceed end user expectations. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.Maintains, designs, implements, and administers Sartori Company’s instance of JDE and related business systems.Provides application support, troubleshooting and training to the end user community. Applications include, but are not limited to, JDEdwards, Hubble and Cloud Inventory.Manages and participates in project teams to achieve project goals within budget and project timelines. Collaborates with business resources to define and document business requirements, gains consensus on solution(s) and implements technology solutions that are aligned with corporate and/or departmental objectives.Manages business system development lifecycle and other documentation needs for long-term reference and support. Proactively manages changes in project scope, identifies potential issues, and creates contingency plans to ensure objectives are met. Conducts project postmortems and recommends future improvements focused on people, processes, and technology.Ensures adequate testing and debugging of applications and processes before implementation.Collaborates with external software support to find solutions.Manages the work of outsourced analysts and programmers.Performs application configuration.Seeks opportunities to re-engineer business processes by anticipating future end user and company Business System needs.Stays abreast of and incorporates technological advancements consistent with the company's strategic objectives.Participate in the Business Systems team’s “on-call” rotation to support the business during and outside normal business hours.Will do minor travel to support project implementation when needed.QUALIFICATIONSTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below represent the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCEBachelor’s Degree required.5(+) years of Business Systems Analyst experience implementing technology solutions in an ERP environment.Experience with JDE EnterpriseOne Order-to-Cash, Record-to-Report, Logistics/Warehouse Management processes preferred.OTHER KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIESThorough knowledge of developing solutions and analytical skills using JD Edwards (preferred) or another major ERP system.Advanced interviewing, listening, and observational skills used to identify and define business and technical needs.Leadership, project/process management, quality commitment and relationship management skills.Ability to program in any of the following is a plus: JDEdwards, MS SQL Server stored procedures and queries, Microsoft Analysis, Microsoft Reporting Services, SharePoint, and Cloud Inventory.To be goal-oriented through demonstrated ability to bring the benefits of technology to solve business issues while also managing costs and risk. Ability to be collaborative and personable through communication and understanding the needs of non-technical internal clients.Ability to manage and deliver multiple development projects on time and within budget.Ability to mesh well across all business units by being a good listener, a team builder and an articulate advocate of their business information and technology needs.PHYSICAL DEMANDS The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by a Team Member to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the Team Member is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and talk or hear. The Team Member is occasionally required to stand; walk; reach with hands and arms; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The Team Member must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, and ability to adjust focus.WORK ENVIRONMENT The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those a Team Member encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. title: Associate Business Systems Analyst
job_description: Your Story.The Associate Business Systems Analyst will be responsible for the following tasks: learning, assisting, and/or executing the analysis, configuration, implementation, support, and testing of enterprise business application software systems. These systems primarily focus on Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and related or integrated systems, including various modules of SAP (both on-premise and cloud-based), Product Lifecycle Management (PLM), Warehouse Management (WMS), Transportation Management (TMS), Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES), Electronic Data Interchange (EDI), Laboratory Information Management (LIMS), and other relevant systems. Additionally, the role includes specific responsibility for continually improving knowledge of the relevant applications portfolio.Your Passion. Our Culture.At Sargento, you work for a company you believe in, with a family of people who believe in you. Our culture stems from a simple premise: Hire good people and treat them like family. At Sargento, you can make decisions based on how they affect people as well as the long-term health of our company. You will be encouraged to make a meaningful difference in the community, in the company and in your career. With diverse experiences and tools to learn and develop, you can transform your aspirations into reality. If you’re ready for the right place to belong and grow your career, you can find it here.Benefits that set us apart.Comprehensive medical including Fertility, Adoption benefits, Dental, and Vision InsuranceFlexible Work WeekHybrid work schedule – Onsite Tuesday – Thursday with the option to work remotely Monday and FridayCompressed work week – Option of ½ day FridayOnsite Health & Wellness Center:Employer 401K contribution in the top 1% of the nationRelocation AssistanceTuition AssistanceAccess to Employee StoreWhat You Do. Support existing system solutions to address business requirements and processes under the guidance of senior member(s). Participates in team activities to address prioritized backlog of requirements. Updates existing application configurations to meet design requirements in full compliance with formal change management and other governance protocols. May rotate between application areas of focus to achieve breadth of experience.Under the direction of direct line supervisor, builds expertise in the broad application architecture and functionality which may include various modules of SAP and other allied and/or integrated solutions. May also include developing/understanding ABAP coding. Supports end-to-end business process view for all applications assigned in collaboration with the full Business Applications Team and with business users.Maintains documentation to describe solution configuration, process flow and behavior, testing, defects, and incident/problem resolution. Updates training documents for new or modified processes or functionality for business users or technical support staff.Provides technical assistance by responding to inquiries from others regarding errors, problems, or questions about system processes or configuration.May be responsible for reacting to all off-hour calls regarding system problems in a prompt and reasonable time.Your Education and Experience.Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field required0-2 years of ERP-related IT Applications experience (regardless of specific ERP solution knowledge)SAP functional or ABAP coding/support experience a plusWorking and engaging in an Agile team environment a plusCertification in any SAP S/4 HANA module is of significant benefitOur Story.With over 2,400+ employees and net sales of $1.8 billion, Sargento Foods is a family-owned company that has been a leader in cheese for more than 70 years. We created the world’s first, successful pre-packaged sliced and shredded natural cheeses. Sargento is based in Plymouth, Wisconsin, where we manufacture and market shredded, sliced and snack natural cheese products, as well as ingredients and sauces. Sargento is known for the exceptional quality of our products and for product design, packaging and merchandising innovations that have transformed our industry.To learn more about our culture and values, please visit our website at https://careers.sargento.com/us/en.

title: Senior Financial Analyst (Hybrid)

title: Resource Management Associate

title: Software QA Analyst II- Connectivity
job_description: A career at Generac means stepping into a company that leads technological advances. For more than five decades, Generac has designed and manufactured diesel, natural gas, and bi-fuel generators, but we’ve evolved into so much more. As we continue to grow in both size and technological advances, we consistently push past norms to pave a way towards the future. We are not simply satisfied with what is working now. Instead, we challenge ourselves to revolutionize and optimize the industry while bringing out the best in our people.As a QA Analyst II, you will be a critical member of our team developing iPhone, Android and web apps that enable IoT devices. This isn’t an average position where you might be restricted to one small piece of an application, but the opportunity to test and validate high performing software as part of a commercial product. As part of a closely knit and collaborative product team, you will be working with Product Managers, Business Analysts, UX/UI Designers, and Testers to deliver engaging IoT-based solutions for Generac customers. You’ll need to be well versed in mobile and web apps, API’s, cloud infrastructure, SQL and NoSQL databases and modern testing approaches and tools. Working closely with the technical team you will be responsible for executing test cases, developing test cases, and completing product testing under the direction of a senior level tester. Essential Duties & Responsibilities:Develop, maintain and execute test plans. timeliness of deliverables, and quality control Prepares system/technical documentation Works under the configuration management plan Performs and supervises the technical aspects of the tasks title: Senior System Integration Analyst
job_description: POSITION PURPOSEProvide advanced-level programming and analysis with the advanced skills necessary to code, test, debug, and implement new and/or existing programs while increasing systems analysis responsibilities and continuing to develop the programming core. Assist in analyzing, designing, and developing solutions related to existing computer systems, applications, and software. Provide working knowledge of the functional processes within the assigned system(s).DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESProvides advanced-level programming and analysis to design, code, test, and document existing and new programs/systems using current standards.Provides timely support and resolution implementation by assisting in analyzing, designing, and developing solutions related to new and/or existing computer systems, applications, and software.Assists other team members with programming techniques and skills to help advance their knowledge.Communicates with end users for direction and guidance on assigned tasks, particularly in obtaining sign-offs of test results, and discusses new information with others.Provides research and recommendations for improvements of existing systems, applications, and programs.Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned and requested.QUALIFICATIONSEducation and ExperienceBachelor's or Associate's degree in computer science or equivalent experience.Two to five years of relevant development experience.Knowledge and SkillsWillingness and ability to acquire expertise in supporting other programming languages and tools.Familiarity with integration protocols.Strong knowledge of data transformation, data mapping techniques, and creating canonical data models.In-depth knowledge of web service and API creation using both SOAP/REST services.Experience with creating Integration architecture or Enterprise Application Integration architecture designs.Expertise in XML, XSLT, XPath.Proficient with writing SQL queries.Strong experience creating architectural and technical designs.Excellent problem-solving skills.ABOUT THE ORGANIZATIONAbout MGEMGE generates and distributes electricity to 163,000 customers in Dane County, Wisconsin, and purchases and distributes natural gas to 176,000 customers in seven south-central and western Wisconsin counties. MGE is a regulated utility subsidiary of the investor-owned public utility holding company MGE Energy, Inc. MGE's roots in the Madison area date back more than 150 years.An industry leader, MGE was among the first utilities nationwide to commit to net-zero carbon electricity by 2050, consistent with global climate science. Your community energy company is investing in a more sustainable future for the benefit of all our customers, investors, and employees. As your community energy company, we are committed to this area and its people. We take responsibility to:Plan and provide a safe, reliable, and cost-effective energy supply that balances the needs and values of those we serve.Provide information and education to serve our customers and stakeholders and help inform their energy decisions.Preserve and protect our environment while providing affordable, reliable energy.Encourage and support economic and business development to keep our economy strong and vibrant.Engage in open and honest dialogue, partnership, and collaboration to best serve our customers and the broader community. Our ValuesSafety: Safety is a core value at MGE. The safety of our employees, customers, and communities is our top priority. Our culture initiatives continuously improve our safety performance. MGE has earned numerous safety awards for this safety performance, including the AGA Leading Indicator Safety Award.Reliability: We invest in our people and in our systems to help ensure top-ranked energy reliability that helps to maintain the economic health and vitality of the communities we serve. MGE is a national leader in electric reliability.Sustainability: With a commitment to transparency, accountability, and continuous improvement, we take a holistic and proactive approach to sustainable practices company-wide.Equity: We are committed to equity and inclusion in our service to our customers, in our workplace, and in our broader community, and we value diverse perspectives, ideas, cultures, and backgrounds. MGE's parent company is MGE Energy, Inc., a public utility holding company. Its common stock trades on the NASDAQ Stock Market. For more information, visit mge.com and mgeenergy.com. JOB LOCATIONThe position is hybrid, and office days are in downtown Madison, Wisconsin, where MGE is an active participant in community efforts to preserve the area's extraordinary quality of life. We offer free, on-site parking and are located near biking trails and bus stops. Many employees enjoy the use of our many on-site EV charging stations.AA/EOE-Minorities/Females/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation/Disabled/Vets

title: Senior Financial Analyst
job_description: Position OverviewDuluth is hiring a Senior Financial Analyst to join our Financial Planning & Analysis (“FP&A”) team. This position will report to the Manager of FP&A and will work closely with other members of Duluth Trading’s Leadership Team. This role interacts with all departments within the company, making it a great opportunity to learn various aspects of the business while putting your finance and analytical skills to work.You will contribute to the success at Duluth by directly supporting financial performance and strategic initiatives. This role leads business performance insights to drive financial results and influence decision making. You will support the development of strategic plans, annual budgets, and monthly forecasts. Position Details  Work Environment: At Duluth Trading Company, we fundamentally believe in strong in-person interactions as our culture thrives when we learn, create, and collaborate with each other. We also believe that the future of work at Duluth Trading Company includes flexibility. The position will be based in our corporate headquarters, near Madison, WI, but it will offer a hybrid work arrangement allowing the flexibility to work a few days a week from home.What You’ll Do: Deliver insights integrating data from diverse sources, and applying analytics to recommend options and inlfuence business decisions.  Evaluate financial results at a department, store, and total company level, highlighting risks and opportunities as well as providing strategic and tactical recommendations to leaders  Communicate and present financial results and forecasts, ensuring reports are clear and understood, including assumptions and dependencies.  Deliver executive-level presentations that tell the story; summarizes key insights for leaders  Support financial planning process through strategic plan, financial plan, and monthly forecast processes  Investigation of existing expenditures with a view to identifying cost savings  Consistent review of existing processes to identify improvements or efficiencies  Prepare ad hoc analyses for CEO, CFO and other Leadership Team members.  What We’re Looking For:  Bachelor's Degree in Bachelor’s degree in accounting or finance Equivalent work experience will be considered.  Familiarity with Data analytics methods and visualization tools  Experience in project management, establishing business systems and process improvements Excellent leadership skills  Extremely high level of accuracy and attention to detail  Strong interpersonal skills to deal effectively with a wide variety of people  Ability to synthesize large quantities of data, identify trends and drivers  Solid analytical and organizational skills  Excellent written and oral communication skills  Advanced Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint skills  3+ years of experience years of experience  No Management Experience Required Duluth Headquarters Benefits And Perks As we continue to grow Duluth Trading Company and its house of brands, the perks have perked up, too. We’ve boosted an already impressive benefits package to include: unlimited paid time-off, 12-week full-pay parental leave, paid holiday time for the important observance of Martin Luther King Jr. Day and Juneteenth, flexible schedules, and more! Why’d we go all out? Because our pursuit of a better way means that when it comes to great talent, better perks are a given. Compensation: $85,000 to $105,000/Year Compensation is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.About Duluth Trading Company Started in 1989, Duluth Trading Company exists to enable hard-working individuals to take on life with their own two hands. Folks that revel in doing it the hard way and celebrate finding a better way. We seek talented individuals who share these beliefs and are excited to further the Duluth Trading legacy with a digital-first mindset, always moving forward and always innovating.  From ingenious Duluth workwear, to comfortably capable Buck Naked Underwear, to outside-embracing AKHG, it’s all about the innovative gear and gadgets that equip customers for a more hands-on way of life.  Top-notch quality, immersive storytelling, outstanding customer service, and the shared belief that the go-all-in-and-dig-deep spirit exists with everyone are what sets Duluth Trading Co. apart. We seek talented folks looking to be part of a can-do team that’s hellbent on helping the world to gear up, get its hands dirty, and do.

title: IT Cybersecurity Analyst - Operational Technology
job_description: WEC Business Services LLC, a subsidiary of WEC Energy Group, is seeking an OT Cybersecurity Analyst in our Milwaukee, Green Bay, or Chicago locations. This position offers flexibility for a hybrid work arrangement (remote/on-site) with time spent in the office.This position is part of a job family (IT Cybersecurity Analyst/Senior IT Cybersecurity Analyst) where experience is the determining factor in placement.Job SummaryAs the Operational Technology (OT) Cybersecurity subject matter expert (SME), you will be a liaison between the IT Cybersecurity Team and stakeholders within the Power Generation, Electrical and Gas Distribution Asset Management businesses. You will assist business areas to maintain WEC Energy Group’s overall OT cybersecurity architecture, governance, policy and processes, and contribute to the roadmap for enterprise level systems. In addition, you are responsible for providing leadership in the OT enterprise cybersecurity tools and vendor evaluation process, and conducting periodic assurance reviews to ensure designs are implemented to the agreed OT cybersecurity architecture.Job ResponsibilitiesDomain-focused Architecture Oversight, Planning, and EnablementMaintain a view of the company’s overall cybersecurity architecture, to ensure appropriate OT domain coverage of security capabilities and identify potential gaps for remediationCollaborate with business units to develop, implement, and maintain system architectures that support OT cybersecurity policies & standards using actionable control lists, implementation guidelines, and required levels of protection that align with enterprise level control framework while prioritizing the system criticality Collaborate with the Governance Risk and Compliance principal to evaluate OT security enterprise tools exception requests, measures, metrics, architecture exception requests and develop & track mitigation plans for the resolution of riskDevelop strategic plans and OT architecture/process requirements based on emerging OT risks and trendsDomain-focused Security Systems & ToolsCollaborate with the security team leads to leverage standardized OT level security systems and tools across system architectures Advise OT domain specific business divisions and local business entities on OT cybersecurity vendor and tools selection, with emphasis on ensuring that tools address OT specific business entity requirements and maximize reusabilityDevelop action (project) plans for OT enterprise systems, aligned to Enterprise Security and Compliance strategy and enterprise security roadmap Minimum QualificationsBachelor’s degree in computer science, computer engineering, software engineering, information technology, computer information systems, MIS, or engineering is preferred. A combination of associate degree, military or professional cybersecurity experience and cybersecurity certification will be considered.2+ years OT cybersecurity architecture design and strategy experiencePreferred QualificationsCertified Information System Security Professional (CISSP) certificationGlobal Industrial Cybersecurity Professional (GICSP) certificationCertified SCADA Security Architect (CSSA) certificationExperience in OT cybersecurity architecture design and strategy within the Power Generation, Gas and Electric business (specifically Industrial Control Systems)Ability to lead and execute the OT cybersecurity strategy for OT business areasIn-depth knowledge of OT cybersecurity architecture that support various components of NIST cybersecurity framework capabilities, such as cybersecurity engineering, vulnerability management, identity management, threat intel, prediction and detection, as well as response and recovery Expertise with OT domain specific cybersecurity vendors and tools, security evaluation processes and assessing risk & developing mitigation plans End Date: 04/30/2024We reserve the right to modify the application deadline or discontinue accepting applications for any position if deemed necessary.Learn more atWEC Energy Group and its subsidiaries are Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or any other protected class.

title: Senior Financial Analyst
job_description: Company / Location InformationWe are one of the leading manufacturers of water heating and water treatment technologies in the world. We are a $3.9 billion company with 150 years of history and employ more than 13,000 individuals globally who pride themselves on providing the world with innovative water technology. We are committed to Continuous Improvement, not just in our factories or processes, but in our people.Recently named one of Milwaukee’s Top Places to Work, we care about our associates and have programs in place to help our team members achieve their potential. When you join our team, you will receive rewards and recognition for your contributions, training, and professional development opportunities, as well as a variety of benefits to support you and your family's health, well-being, and financial future.Primary FunctionResponsible for preparing and analyzing various financial reports and statements as well as maintaining the integrity of all financial documents. Prepare, review, and analyze research projects and analyses including budget, expenses, staffing, rates of return, sensitivity analysis, and financial projections. Provide technical support to operating unit personnel relative to the submission of actual/forecast financial data to Corporate Headquarters.  Maintain and expand the capabilities for electronic distribution of financial reports.  Prepare and review various schedules and analyses in support of both internal and external financial reporting requirements.  Perform other duties as assigned. QualificationsRole Specific Responsibilities Bachelor's degree in accounting or finance  5+ years related work experience  Demonstrated ability to interpret and analyze financial data and reports to identify financial impacts of the data  Working knowledge of financial and accounting systems  Experience with consolidation accounting and financial reporting  Strong attention to detail and high organization skills  Working knowledge of Microsoft Office, especially Excel, Word, Outlook and Access  Strong communication skills, both orally and written, especially communication of financial results and information  Ability to work with and maintain the integrity of confidential information  Ability to work independently and as a team to meet strict deadlines while balancing priorities EducationBachelor's Degree in Accounting or FinanceYears Of ExperienceMinimum of 5 years related work experienceWe OfferCompetitive compensation package and comprehensive benefits plans which include medical and dental insurance, company-sponsored life insurance, retirement security savings plan, short- and long-term disability programs and tuition assistance.This role is eligible to participate in our hybrid work program, which allows employees to work remotely up to two days per week. title: Investment Analyst Intern - Private Debt & Equity, Summer 2025
job_description: At Northwestern Mutual, we are strong, innovative and growing. We invest in our people. We care and make a positive difference.Internship candidates can expect a fulltime onsite internship program, running from June 2025 to August 2025.Carefully selected from universities across the country, our interns bring distinctive ideas and perspectives to our organization. Our employees are passionate about building our emerging talent and future leaders. After application and initial screening conversation, interns are aligned interview and be hired to a specific team at NM based on their skillsets and interests, providing exposure to real-world business perspectives through hands-on learning and meaningful work. In addition to their day-to-day tasks, interns participate in professional development workshops, senior leadership Q&A's, volunteer initiatives, networking/social events, and more!Private Debt and Equity Analyst InternNorthwestern Mutual’s Private Debt and Equity group is a committed investor in the private markets, partnering with leading private equity firms and corporations for the past 30+ years. This dedication has led private equity firms and corporations around the world to rely on us to provide the strategic funding necessary to support leveraged transactions and capital investments.An Investment Analyst with Northwestern Mutual Capital evaluates direct private equity and debt investment opportunities across a broad range of industries. The analyst works alongside senior deal team members to assist in all aspects of the transaction, including analyzing, modeling, and monitoring investments. The role offers a diversified exposure to private equity and fixed income investing, and analysts are heavily involved in the development of cash flow models, investment theses, and various risk analyses. As analysts develop in the role, they are expected to take on more responsibility within the organization by coordinating and communicating directly with corporate executives and presenting investment opportunities directly to the senior members of Northwestern Mutual Capital. The Pre-MBA NMC analyst program provides a unique opportunity to engage with NMC’s Private Equity partners, develop a strong analytical framework, and succeed in a high-volume, lean deal team environment.Bring Your Best! title: Senior Financial Analyst/Underwriter, New Market Tax Credits (NMTC)
job_description: OverviewBaker Tilly US, LLP (Baker Tilly) is a leading advisory CPA firm, providing clients with a genuine coast-to-coast and global advantage in major regions of the U.S. and in many of the world’s leading financial centers - New York, London, San Francisco, Los Angeles and Chicago. Baker Tilly is an independent member of Baker Tilly International, a worldwide network of independent accounting and business advisory firms in 145 territories, with 41,000 professionals and a combined worldwide revenue of $4.7 billion. Please discuss the work location status with your Baker Tilly talent acquisition professional to understand the requirements for an opportunity you are exploring.Baker Tilly is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable federal, state or local law.ResponsibilitiesIt’s an exciting time to join Baker Tilly! We are looking for a Senior Financial Analyst/Underwriter to join our Capital Formation Team.The Capital Formation Team at Baker Tilly (BT) is comprised of dedicated, client-focused professionals specializing in capital sourcing for real estate projects and operating businesses nationwide. Our specialized team assists project sponsors in securing and structuring capital for new construction, expansion, and acquisition/rehabilitation of real estate and the expansion of job creating operating businesses.BT’s New Markets Tax Credit (NMTC) team is an industry leading financial consulting group which has been involved in the NMTC industry since its inception over 20 years ago. The team presently maintains offices in Illinois, Texas and Wisconsin and is comprised of professionals with significant NMTC and structured finance experience.The NMTC team works closely with For-Profit and Non-Profit organizations to secure tax credits, structure the financing, and maximize the capital stack while working with multiple financing sources. The team provides deep industry expertise and leverages extensive relationships with NMTC stakeholders including community development entities, Investors and lenders for our client engagements.Our employees thrive in a challenging, supportive environment, taking on a high level of responsibilities as Valued Business Advisers to our clients. This position is client facing and requires attention to detail, critical thinking, project management skills. Performance is rewarded and there are many professional opportunities to grow within the team.As a Senior Financial Analyst With BTs NMTC Team, You Will Work Closely With Partners And Senior Managers Providing High-value Structured Finance Consulting For The Benefit Of For-Profit And Non-Profit Clients. Specific Responsibilities Include:Seek information from project sponsors to analyze community impacts of projectsCollaborate with and assist team with financing structures to support NMTC or related financingsPrepare executive summary pitchbooks for projects to source NMTC capital, investment and subsidy from development entities and investors [primarily national banks]Assist team to identify and interact with the financing participants and investorsAssist team in obtaining and negotiating term sheetsPrepare preliminary financial modelsGather, organize and analyze due diligenceAssist in project management responsibilitiesAssist in the closing and documentation of the NMTC related financingQualificationsSuccessful candidates will meet the following requirements:Two + years of lending, finance or accounting related experience including internships in related fields or industry. Work experience with NMTCs, commercial lending or community development preferredAn undergraduate degree in Business Administration with emphasis in Accounting, Finance, or real estate preferredDemonstrated analytical, organizational, interpersonal, project management, and communication skillsAbility to provide exceptional client service and demonstrate commitment to continuous learning in order to stay current regarding applicable strategiesUnderstanding of financials and operating performanceSuccessful candidate will have a willingness to work in BT Offices on a regular hybrid basis and to travel as required [generally short duration]

title: Senior Tax Analyst
job_description: Overview Molson Coors is recruiting for the exciting position of State Senior Tax Analyst on our U.S. state tax team based in Milwaukee. The State Senior Tax Analyst is responsible for key components of our annual U.S. state income and franchise tax compliance process. This role also supports preparation and review of the Company’s estimated state tax calculations and quarterly income tax provision calculation, including forecasting and modeling of our state effective tax rate. Reporting to the State Senior Tax Manager, the State Senior Tax Analyst will have ample opportunities for technical growth, as well as professional, leadership and career development in an environment that fosters continuous learning, collaboration, and excellence. Candidates who are detailed-oriented with strong analytical skills and solid grasp of tax laws and regulations regardless of specialization, will find this opportunity compelling. Moreover, there’s ample room for professional growth and advancement within the role.   Key Responsibilities Support the U.S. state income and franchise tax compliance process including preparation and review of tax returns, estimates and extensions in all 50 states and numerous local taxing jurisdictions. Assist in the preparation and review of the Company’s quarterly and annual state tax provisions and accounting for uncertain positions related to our domestic operations, and support compliance with our internal accounting controls. Assist in the forecasting of our interim period state effective tax rate as well as cash tax liability, including the preparation and review of tax entries and related explanations of key activity and variances for Company leadership. Lead the determination of the Company’s U.S. state apportionment and income allocation, and key state tax adjustments and tax credit utilization.  Research and analyze the implications of multistate income tax law changes and business developments, including state modifications to federal taxable income, filing methodologies, and income apportionment. Identify opportunities to cultivate tax technology and standardize processes to transform state income tax processes. Guide the successful resolution of audits and inquiries into the Company’s U.S. state income and franchise tax positions by taxing authorities through preparation of information requests and liaison with auditing agents. Collaborate cross-functionally within Tax and with the business to ensure compliance with state income and franchise tax regulations, optimize tax strategies, and provide valuable insights to support the decision-making process. Candidate Profile The successful candidate must possess a strong desire to grow and learn and appreciate a challenging, yet rewarding work experience. She or he should be able to effectively manage competing priorities and deadlines within Molson Coors’ fast-moving environment and flexible hybrid work arrangement. The successful candidate must be collaborative and a strong team player who asks questions and seeks new ways to approach existing challenges. Required Experience Bachelor’s degree in Finance or Accounting At least 4 years of U.S. state income and franchise tax compliance experience with a large public accounting firm or large U.S. corporation  Demonstrated experience with certain U.S. state income tax principles and concepts, including income apportionment, nexus, conformity, and credits and incentives Basic “ASC 740” knowledge with specific awareness of deferred tax accounting, uncertain tax positions and valuation allowances Demonstrated experience with SAP or similar ERP system and Corptax or similar income tax software Strong analytical skills and attention to detail Effective written and verbal communication skillsStrong Microsoft Excel skills Preferred Experience Strong knowledge of SAP or similar ERP system and Corptax or similar income tax software Experience analyzing U.S. federal and state income tax legislation Experience managing audits and inquiries by U.S. state taxing authorities, including performing related diligence and drafting responses to information requests Experience supporting the analysis and implementation of U.S. state tax planning opportunities Basic knowledge of U.S. state indirect tax concepts, including understanding the property, excise and sales & use tax implications of business activity Experience with Microsoft Power Automate tools, including data query and Power BI  Work Perks that You Need to Know About:  Flexible work programs that support work life balance including a hybrid work model of 3 days in the office We care about our People and Planet and have challenged ourselves with stretch goals around our key priorities We care about our communities, and play our part to make a difference – from charitable donations to hitting the streets together to build parks, giving back to the community is part of our culture and who we are Engagement with a variety of Employee Resource Groups, which can provide volunteer opportunities, leadership experience, and networking through the organization Ability to grow and develop your career centered around our First Choice Learning opportunities Participation in our Total Rewards program with a competitive base salary, incentive plans, parental leave, health, dental, vision, 401k option with incredible employer match, generous paid time off plans, an engaging Wellness Program, and an Employee Assistance Program (EAP) with amazing resources On site Pub, access to cool brand clothing and swag, top events and, of course... free beer and beverages!  Work within a fast paced and innovative company, meeting passionate colleagues and partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences

The candidate for this position should have a strong understanding of large-scale enterprise systems and have a demonstrated expert knowledge of Java coding and web applications including Java Server Faces Framework.CGS brings motivated, highly skilled, and creative people together to solve the government’s most dynamic problems with cutting edge technology. We combine cutting edge technology with world-class personnel to deliver customized solutions that fit our clients’ specific needs. title: Product Manager
job_description: C2 client, a thriving global software company that believes that ecommerce software should enable sustainable growth and their two ecommerce applications exemplify that belief. They seek a Product Manager to focus on the development of product planning processes for client ecommerce products. Your objective will be to conduct an in-depth analysis of the market needs, customer needs, market trends, and competitor offerings to identify opportunities for product enhancement and differentiation.Our client is building something special. Awesome ecommerce software and a great place for team members to bring their whole selves to work. Their people are passionate about the work and enjoy cracking jokes along the way. The teams tackle complex challenges and work together to create innovative solutions, celebrating every little victory along the way. They're committed to helping team members grow their career while joining an organization that values cultivating a feeling like a family.Start date: As soon as they find the right personDuration: Full-time Direct HireLocation: Hybrid in Wauwatosa, WI with Tues./Thurs. in officeCompensation: Commensurate with experienceProduct Information:The company developed two software products, an ecommerce product customization platform that allows shoppers to personalize, customize, and configure products as well as an enterprise, B2B ecommerce platform with a rich set of built-in features to easily manage content, site search, product information, and multi-store functionality.Job Summary:In this role, you will lead the product planning processes for a vertical market, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive innovation and growth. Additionally, you will develop and execute product strategies, from conception to launch, for vertical markets ensuring alignment with company goals and customer satisfaction.Responsibilities:Drive the entire product lifecycle for a particular vertical, including market research, competitor analysis, roadmap development, technology partnerships, and product launchTranslate product strategy into detailed requirements, guiding engineering teams through prototyping and final development stagesCreate comprehensive product strategy documents outlining business cases and business requirementsCollaborate closely with engineering, marketing, and sales teams to ensure successful product development, QA, release, and communication/trainingCollaborate with marketing to create product positioning and messaging that highlights company unique value proposition in the vertical marketsRequirements:5+ years of proven experience in software product management, with a track record of successfully leading cross-functional teamsExceptional analytical skills and the ability to translate market insights into actionable product strategiesStrong communication skills, including writing, editing, and presentation abilitiesBachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in product design, engineering, or related fieldNice-to-haves:Previous experience in ecommerce product managementExperience in a Business Analyst roleDemonstrated success in product development in a non-managerial roleTechnical background is a plusNot your type of gig, but know someone who would be interested? Refer a qualified candidate, and if they get the job, you get a signing bonus! (Make sure they mention your name as their referral source so you get your well-deserved credit!)All candidates must be located and authorized to work in the United States. C2 does not sponsor work visas. No C2C.
Job function: Product Management, Strategy/Planning, and Business Development
Industries: Software Development and IT System Custom Software Development
